Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fhm3FYR0nOdvyzGfUR87Sg.text: I probably go here every time I visit Vegas because this taco place never disappoints! Its always busy when I come but the line goes by pretty fast. I'm a huge fan of the adobada (spicy pork) fries and pretty much any of the other meat tacos. If you are unfamiliar with how this place works, there are different lines depending on the choice of meat you want. You order your tacos first and then pay afterwards. I think its best to have a different person in each line to order for you, that's if you come with a group and then pay all together so that it is an easier process. I'm glad they added an outside section so that there's more space for seating. I'm happy they have locations in San Diego now but I can't wait until they have some in Los Angeles! I would highly recommend this place if you haven't gone yet! You won't regret it.

s2hkyF54J4qDvLGSV7mOVQ.text: These tacos are up there with some of the best taco places in Mexico City. Only problem is that the line is always a 30 minute wait (at the very least).

2wgFd_QT_PMhqVI5809Y6w.text: Are you interested in waiting in line for over an hour for "just okay" Mexican food? Well you are at the right place! Tacos El Gordo is supposedly a highly rated and preferred restaurant from what I've heard. This past visit would make number two for me and again I'm left with too much more to desire. I arrived with already have anticipating a long wait, that's a given! Day before a holiday(Thanksgiving) on the Las Vegas strip? Yeah you'd think everybody would be home that night preparing some Thanksgiving dinner but nope!   Organization is something that could've possibly earned this place another star from me but the jury is still out on that. This location unlike the other one I have visited in town didn't seem to have a very good process in place for the crazy line. For starters, those of you who've never been there is about 4 different lines that they normally offer, depending on what kind of meat you want on your order decides on what line you should be standing. That wasn't the case this weekend. Upon arrival I noticed there was a security guard outside which I didn't think too much of because in my mind I thought he just patrolled the entire parking lot. No.. He is designated specifically just for Tacos El Gordo and manning the traffic that goes in and out? Seriously? What the hell goes on here that they need security at a Mexican fast food joint? Inquiring minds would really like to know... Once inside there was a "snake line" meaning that there wasn't no lining up according to the meat you want. Complete chaos! The capacity of the place easily fills up and so the security guard at some points of the wait had to stand in front of the door and make sure that it never exceeds I guess the capacity of what's allowed. Oh okay is this what he is here for? Yikes!  Hungry as I was I just couldn't have an order of a couple tacos. I thought I would treat myself to some campechana fries which is a mixture of the "Al Pastor" and "Carne Asada" meats. Large order will run you $13! Once I was to the ordering station I clearly stated that my choice of order was campechana! The man taking the order and also making the food was an excellent multi-tasker and I really have to commend him on his fast skills! 5 minutes later my order was being prepared and I noticed that the fries were being made without the "Al Pastor" I politely brought this to their attention. Fixed! When my order was being handed to be I guess there was another customer who ordered the same that didn't get his, by the time I took a few steps my order was snatched lol yes.. snatched from another guy. The worker saw this apologized and made me another! Security?! Umm yeah we have a campechana fry snatcher on the loose! On to the next line.. To pay.. I waited another 5 minutes so now we are talking a whole hour and fifteen minutes for some damn fries! Geezee! $14 and some change later I was on my way. Will I be back? Honestly no time soon. I just can't cope with paying $14 for some fries that weren't that spectacular. Whether you want to compare them or not I literally would prefer the Carne Asada fries from Roberto's over these I just ordered and oh save $5! Tacos El Gordo my friend you are just "iight"... **side eye**

There are separate lines once you get inside for the different options. There are two lines open for just adobada. ai enjoyed the lengua tacos. Also ordered a half order of the lengua fries. Was not impressed by the fries at all but at least they put a lot of meat on it so that was a plus. I got a small dollop of guac but my fiance got a huge amount for his. Our food was not proportioned the same. Location is super convenient if you're in the north strip area.

XGa2BIevEWAiUD-CcObIlQ.text: Tacos are good here. Every type of meats have a tasty flavor. The lines on the weekend days are horrendous(long). Be prepare to wait a while to eat but food is good. If you can make it here during the week, even better.  I've been here several times now and it's usually the same identical experience. Tacos are about $2.25.-$2.40 each taco. Parking, same thing. Weekday ok, weekend forget it. Overall, good place to eat tacos.

hUVcK9CcKVmqZlHk473K9Q.text: I recommend not to go here. For starters the line is toooooooo long and their idea of a quesadilla is a tortilla on  the bottom,melted cheese and then meat. If you want good food I suggest going to Golden Nugget hotel and trying their restaurants. If your in 3049 South Las Vegas Strip.

38ek1zgK1sp1pW4Msa4tXg.text: When I roll into Las Vegas with Maria Santa Maria, this is the first place we go to eat authentic Mexican food.  She has converted her red head friend to love our tradition.  Delicious street tacos

eb-of_MOrJBg6V9d6Ng76w.text: Usually I expect taco prices to be like $4 or higher, but $2.25 sounds just right. I got like 7 tacos for me and my gf, carne asada and al pastor. I love the part how they added guacamole for the carne asada tacos. The horchata, especially from the soda machines was superb. It tastes like the type of authentic horchata I would taste like from Santa Ana taco food trucks. The only bad thing is that I wish the cashiers knows how to speak better English because I only wanted one drink, but she charged me for two drinks, oh well. When I was in Vegas for 6 days, the last three days, I have been just eating tacos mostly lol. Can't get rid of the taco taste. Can't wait to get them when I'm in Vegas again.

m72gGAGCotE7nZnZNPHaSQ.text: Well, our first time here to tacos el gordo here in Vegas and we definitely were in for a treat. I have to say, the food here is top notch. Very tasty and full of flavor. The wait time was not very long since nice they had 5 different lines to order the different types of tacos. Definitely 2 thumbs up. Our definite stop over next time we visit Vegas

URTMSCfC1_Y2Qf07lqhARA.text: Stumbled here and it was the best food I had in Vegas. Amazing and fresh and authentic.  It's a little chaotic to order but it adds to the charm.  El pastor taco was absolutely perfect.

QshOsSiL90H3C8Otbkowug.text: I dream of these tacos and will wait 50+ mins in a confused state for them. For the daring ones, please try the lengua tacos. You won't regret it!

4K7xnUT7SKYuLcB6AoUFZQ.text: We tried Mulas, sopas, and quesadillas, and they were all amazing. We'll have to go back again for the tacos.   The downside is that the whole place is a bit chaotic and there is almost always a long line. If you can get past the struggle that is ordering, it's definitely worth it.

9RpLXpItfjrUX1Cyo8Bj5A.text: I was born and raised in Mexico City and this spot is better than most taco shops there.

MCGWL2O9oYVzF-TLef8Fng.text: Real deal tacos! This is one of my stops when I go to Vegas. I love this place. This is not the gentrified take by local non cooking foodies- this is great Mexican food!

ltM6NHxLAs-StGBZysKjRA.text: Home made tortillas! You will always see a line out the door, that's how good the food is! Tacos al pastor are the best here. Totally recommend coming here for your taco fix.

_5z7lpuEaKXxsIV_IRkUtQ.text: Best tacos ever! The prices are reasonable for the quality and size of them. The carne asada was overcooked and burnt but the al pastor was amazing. It's always packed, so expect a wait. These tacos are similar to the ones in Tijuana and the handmade tortillas are delicious.  Definitely worth the visit! It's 15 min away from the MGM, it's located in old town Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos al pastor!

lpwRYMYN2vAjIU-BfT77QQ.text: Let me sing you a lil song about tacos and it goes something like this...  This is the US Mecca of tacos! The "full house"of tacos! I've had street  tacos in Mehico City and these are the real deal Holyfield! I'm speaking specifically about the carne adobada al pastor kind on flower tortillas. Ask nicely and you can get flour tortillas instead of the corn too. Hey.... I'm a gringo!  You get the crispy pork, red hot sauce, green sauce, onions and cilantro. Hold the cilantro on mine! They are amazing! I can't comment on the other types of tacos they serve because these were so good I didn't get around to trying any of the others.  I went multiple times on out trip to Vegas. I couldn't get enough! They also have a pineapple fountain drink that reminds me of an Orange Julius. Very sweet but very good!  I planned my next trip to Vegas around this place. We will be staying at the Wynn Encore which is right across the street! If you have to wait in line do so.. it's very worth it!  This place is legit!

0e23juynw4udBJnYhqWW7w.text: I'm throwing out a lot of 5 star reviews lately, but I think they are deserving.  The tacos were legit, spicy pork was the best.   Order from the station that is serving what you want, there are several stations and there is some overlap of what you can get from each one.  The guy who greeted us who was working behind the counter was really helpful.  He was also patient, b/c it took us a while to figure things out and to order.  Lucky for us there was no line (we also lucked out with parking).  We ate here sober fyi, I can only imagine that this place would be even better if you were drunk.  I really like the tortillas and the sauce and you can ask for grilled green onions and peppers for free.  Also if you want to be fancy and also enjoy your taco more, ask for some pineapple on top.  It is such a tasty bonus!  The dining area was clean and they did a great job wiping down tables, taking trays etc.  They had a good system going.  They also had a bathroom and the sink was outside the bathroom which was helpful.  After eating, I had to wash my hands and was glad I didn't have to wait in line for the bathroom just to do that.  The tacos are also affordable and provide a good value.  You really can't go wrong here.

pICXdrubXbk8omOpR8rALg.text: I've been to another tacos el gordo in California and they all have the same set up. Order your tacos then pay. I think it was a good idea if there wasn't lines. I went to the lengua/buche/cabeza line and my bf made a line for the al pastor line. He got his tacos and I was still in line. He made the next line to pay for the tacos. I was still in line. He ate his tacos I was still in line. By the time I got my tacos made it to the paying line another 5 minutes all my tacos were cold. Set up is all bad. Not to say the taquero making the lengua and buche was slow asf. Ponte las pilas compa. I'm sure they are making mad cash they should figure out a better system so I could enjoy my tacos warm next time.

vtqlOyEMNZspXH_5oPb77w.text: Tacos el gordo, what a great name. Made our way over here by uber and arrived at 11am. They open at 10am and the place was packed. When we left there was a line forming on the sidewalk. There are several lines to order from. If you want carne asada/steak there are several lines, then lines for other types of meat. It was confusing at first but then we got the concept. Personally, I thought the concept was a bit weird because if you want a carne asada taco and a lengua taco you need to stand in 2 separate lines. Probably not to cross contaminate the meat but it was kind of lame. The line I stood in took like what it seemed forever and a day. When you finally make it to the front you need to shout out your order. It took us 20 minutes to get to the front of our line and another 5 to prepare the food. The cooks are pretty good about getting everything but they will more than likely ask you again. It is very hot inside so be ready for that.   Once you get your food make your way over to the register and pray there is a seat available. We got lucky and scored a couple. We ordered a total of 6 tacos and 2 fountain drinks for $18. One of the least expensive meals I have ever had on the strip in Vegas.    Tortillas are freshly made. The portions are generous. At $2.25/taco you are getting a good deal. Mainly because the guacamole is not an additional charge and you get a huge portion on top. I ordered 2 carne asada tacos and 1 taco Azteca which is a carne asada taco topped with nopales (cactus). I loved my tacos. I thought they were phenomenal. People were friendly. I would go back if the lines were shorter. It is 5-stars for the food but ordering food in different lines wasn't my thing. I'm sure it works for them. Give them a try. The tacos will not disappoint. Happy eating!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco Azteca, asada with nopalitos (cactus). So good. $2.25
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here&#39;s a tip, it&#39;s &#34;Thanks&#34;. Haha

SHo2aOnupMzhi7Nd4RL6SA.text: They close at 2 am not 4am was pussed drove all the way there for nothing! Update correct hrs!

kMK7qQhvE1WjnahYN-PE2w.text: The adobada tacos are the reason to come here.  All the others are still good but not amazing in my book.  The floor plan could use some work too with the  register placement sometimes creating lines that block traffic.  It can get very busy in here but if you've never been I do recommend it.  I wish they had some fish tacos too.

tzWujPY38oMlKxhQjzXpdg.text: I came here before I hit up Encore for some fun. Best decision ever. This place was poppin' at 10am in the morning or something - tells you how good this place is.   I ordered all of the 'safe' normal stuff - carne asada, chorizo, carnitas, and they were great. Carnes asade was my favorite! Beef had amazing flavor and the melange of onions. lime and guac was great. I would say this is the best carne asada taco I've had. I'd say the chorizo and carnitas lacked a bit of flavor and the texture was a bit dry but still good. My favorite thing here, was their peppers. You can ask for roasted veggies/peppers on the side free of charge! They have both green and white and they complemented the tacos to perfection. Cook well, a bit too well (slightly brown/black) but they were just cooked to perfection. Texture was hard on the outside, soft on the inside.  I'd recommend everyone to hit this place up, and not some other taco place. It's impossible to miss.

IagatC4R3oC2YWfT3TElhg.text: Good tacos, long lines. More of a fast food place but don't let that detract you from coming. The loaded french fries were delicious

UqYa3Z_uu5QeI-2RU1Em6Q.text: Best tacos in Las Vegas. I get militas and the carne Asada fries. The red salsa is so good and everything is real good. Even though they are super busy they still have good customer service. Keep in mind they're busy so it's not gonna be like having a personal waitress.

CzMMq3KMv96C1xu_S5sjcg.text: My brother and I were hungry after eating a light dinner and it came to my attention that one of three Tacos El Gordo's in Vegas was located right down the road from our hotel. It's across the street from Encore and it gets a little sketchy but totally worth it! I came Wednesday over winter break, a little before midnight, and I was very surprised that there was minimal waiting. They have different lines so be prepared to split your group up to try all the meats. And don't be conservative with the amount of food you order here because the tacos are on the smaller side and you won't want to wait again in the line!  The guys that make your tacos are so quick and they cut the meat on the spot when you order. El Pastor is always my favorite and don't forget to order it with the pineapples and Carne Asada would come up us as a close second. My least favorite was the Chorizo because it was a little overdone and dry. I got a chance to try a couple Mulas but it does take awhile for them to make. I was too lazy to wait in the line again so next time, I'm going to try their Carne Asada fries. After you're done ordering, you go to the counter by the exit to pay. Tacos are a little over $2 bucks each, which isn't bad considering it's on the strip.  P.S. Don't forget to ask for roasted peppers and grilled veggies, free of charge!

_ydVVVOzR7ZchR8vvplqeg.text: Solid 4 stars, had no idea how busy this place was. Had stopped by during a layover in the city and expected to have time to go check out another landmark, but I must have been in line for at least 40 minutes because it was such so packed. (Line out the building and around the corner patio area). Once you move up in the line you get to watch the cooks moving quickly almost in a symphony orquestrating some savory and mouth watering tacos. So on top of the long line, another hassle is that with the way the store is set up you have to pick what type of meat you will want for your tacos and then commit to that because you would have to get back in another line to get other meat. So, definitely come here! Just be ready to stand for a while in line unless you come during some random hours.

gyTrIlnQ1Ia6bgx5KUrCeA.text: All I have to say is bomb.com so worth the wait!!! Definitely a must when we are in Vegas!

EeCv6AU0eGNdxjHPKJ3lpQ.text: The best taco shop I've been to. The service was great and very fast. The store was clean taken care of. I ordered the steak tacos and also the pork tacos. The flavor and freshness, out of this world. I will definitely return and recommend this to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r5WW5fPXXKZn71a3JkR7oA.text: Talk about amazing tacos! Chicago may be well known for its taco scene but a Tacos El Gordo is defintely needed. I wish I could eat here everyday.  I can't wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas!

lSjKA8pkS7dJPiydMT-kUQ.text: The experience here was absolutely amazing. My friends and I came to this place around 11 AM on a Friday, and luckily the lines were not that long. Right after we finished ordering though, the lines were going out the door... I don't think you can ever avoid lines at this place!  Food: I had ordered the abodaba tacos and asada tacos. They were $2.50 each, which is a bit pricey for tacos, but we know this place is known for great quality so that was fine. I wish I got some more abodaba tacos because they were amazing and my friends were raving about chorizo tacos! Honestly, the asada tacos were really good but I think I can get that kind of taste at any taco stands. Nonetheless, they were all yummy! I only ordered 3 tacos and I was still hungry lol. My friends and I decided to split the carne asada fries, which was the best decision I made during my Vegas trip. It was SO good, and nothing back home will beat the taste.  P.S. Get the horchata, you won't regret it.   Seating: The place has lots of places to sit, except there are so many people there. We had to often tell people that seats were taken while my friends went to go use the restroom or wait in line for some more food.  Service: it was okay. The people who work there are not nice, but they're not rude either. They do look like they don't want to be there. Also, the workers take your trays and trash for you, which is really nice, but they do it in a way so that you'll leave and make room for other people. We understood we couldn't stay for long, but we ate pretty rushed. Other than that, it wasn't a too bad of an experience!  If you're ever in Vegas or SD, you should definitely check out this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobada (left) &amp; asada (top right)

Eh3D49EhrDeKyZM7fzYbBQ.text: Bugs and flys everywhere. Not a good place to eat. Very disorganized and place is outdated.

slNjOcbTRnk662962H3LCA.text: Food is amazing the line system takes getting use to.  A def need to stop by place . Glad they have many locations but they need to come up to the Bay Area

IPz3oX0q9qpm8vBa-KTZag.text: Best tacos in Vegas. I only like the spicy pork which isn't spicy and the steak. The chorizo was from a sausage i really didn't like that. I didn't like the beef either. It was just boiled beef. Maybe i was expecting ground beef not shredded. But overall still was good!!!

PjPhK9WI27CpkOn7zt4Asg.text: Meat is very good. Home made tortillas are my fav I love tacos  this places is always packed and parking is horrible

However, the other three (asada, tripa, and chorizo) were severely overcooked and burnt. Next time, we will definitely stay away from the latter three and order the adobada and lengua only and probably try a few others.

TdYP-ngtSg8mUynN-LNynQ.text: Want some real authentic Mexican tacos go eat here! They were delicious. I really enjoyed the asada tacos the meat was very flavorful. Also we had to ask for the chiles asados too and they only give you one wth a couple of grilled onions. But over all very delicious.

UJU_3GeEy7JlXxcbEdscRg.text: I don't usually eat pork... I don't like it. I ordered the Pork taco with everything on it because there was no chicken. Best taco I've ever had. I was shocked!!! Staff and sweet and helpful. One downside- Wicked long confusing lines to get food.

UU_SwhJ0ps9H9d_eloSWgQ.text: Went there after reading all the great reviews here, service is fast. But no chicken options and chicken being my go-to meat while eating out - I was a little bummed. Considering the low prices especially compared to all the food places on the Strip, the food is not too bad.

ZwmrE7pzBleX2Te4qZSYXA.text: Good tacos but long wait time. I think they really need to work on a better way to streamline the ordering process to make it less chaotic. I think people should pay for their tacos and be given a number, then someone would call their number to hand them the tacos.

apaHaz6S6t_i-0CGb3W5NQ.text: A Vegas trip is incomplete without a visit (or two or three) here! You know it's bomb dot com when it tastes like heaven whether you're drunk after the day club/nightclub OR sober!!!  No joke, come grab a few tacos (my fav are carne asada with guac on the side & pastor) and some grilled green onions and you'll thank me later.   There are multiple lines to order certain meats.  Takes about 10 min to get food during non peak hours but just expect for there to always be a line no matter when you go. It's THAT good!

x-6vMMxuNjvK0DnTa7BwwQ.text: Perfect straight from LVS, right upon open. Limited menu variety (tacos, duh!).  But the meats we tried were flavorful. Especially enjoyed the pork.   BYOB, but they frown upon glass bottles. Easily walkable from Wynn.

TRlWNJfFbyBE2nlQyZE4FA.text: If u like waiting for food truck quality , u in the right place . If u like wasting ur time ur in the right place , if u like waiting on people waiting ur in the right place . If u like pigeons ur in the right place .

tw9C10jkIVOQrFXtyr6aCQ.text: Down the strip from the Wynn. This place is delicious. Fast friendly service. Plenty of room to sit and eat. Alpastor and carne asada were amazing, cheese quesadilla was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iW0eDY-elbttgilyCeHtgg.text: I'm so pleased! The spicy pork is amazing. Not very spicy just full of flavor! Appeared a bit crowded but the line moves really fast.

7O6ANGhCoMj4ABOGMhzBKA.text: Tacos are good but nothing separates this place from the millions of other taco places in the Southwest of the United States.  Ate some tacos today while in Vegas and was like Meh.

jurH1aB3sqg15fE_VIG_4A.text: I finally had the opportunity to try out Tacos el Gordo, without the crazy lines and sober to say the least lol for its proper judgement.  This past weekend we went to Vegas to celebrate my cousins 25th birthday, and all weekend I was really craving tacos. Finally, before leaving I told them lets go and they agreed. For once the lines weren't out the door like they normally are which made me really excited. I was a bit overwhelmed as to what to get but finally decided on 2 tacos and a mulita de asada.  The tacos are Ok and have hand made tortillas. They are not stingy with their meat, sauce or guacamole which is a plus. The mulitas were made the same way and had sooooo much cheese in which I love. The downside to the food was the Carne Asada was wayyyyyyy too salty.   I'm giving it 3 stars because I feel like it's just all hype. I've had better tacos in LA. Also the fact the meat was really salty. Maybe next time it'll be better.

i2RP0pJwhiSB_av-OCY83Q.text: Finally ate at this place while in Vegas and it was amazing!!! I had al pastor tacos and asada mula and it was so tasty and cooked just right.  The lines are long but move fast. The place was clean and staff was friendly. Highly recommend this place is you want authentic mexican food :)

uPPd6DDrNLu-10kMCBeZKg.text: This place is worth the LONG wait.  Was in line for 30 min, but tacos have great smokey flavour to it.  Just be ready for messy lines as everyone wants to get their food too.

rHWqtObxG-_H1--oisAkJQ.text: Really authentic Mexican flavor but the personal are very rude the have a bad actitud.

GvWdbSeBE92ghMA7LSFSkA.text: The food is great and very authentic. The only thing I didn't love about this restaurant was the lack of direction on ordering the tacos. We got into what we thought was the line but it was only the line for the steak tacos. I wanted to try a couple of varieties but could not. I loved the limes that you could get from the condiment area. There were radishes and onions(?) there too. We would definitely return to try other tacos.

3Vl-57LFS5VgFkMBKyb9-w.text: Have visited this concept twice. First time I was not very impressed while the second time I got food poisoning. Never again!!

Qb833afTwgotjnYK1vaseQ.text: Great atmosphere, the food is super fresh, authentic and is reasonably priced. If you're a taco fan this place should be on your bucket list.

HJHxIYbMHHU36rtDzk5xTg.text: No other place for tacos!!!  I have 3 each time, it's filling the best tacos in town. Wish it was a bit cheaper, but worth the taste!

uPDIYRoF3_vA7OLFuYpgMw.text: Eat be Happyyyyyyy & EnjoyYyYyYy!!! OMG the food is HoT & Freshhhhhhhh and fuLL of flavor.  Las Vegas Blvd. & Convention Center is my favorite location. But the El Pastor is BOMB  Best Street Tacos in Vegas  It won't let me post my video but here are a couple of snap shots of the video

dmpvsDEK0-W1OY-wIAeq7A.text: Best Mexican place in VEGAS! Wish they had more locations but can't stop thinking about it

lbgBvrJidhb4O_W-skWBEg.text: Overall: Tacos El Gordo is overhyped. Definitely stop by if you're on the strip and you want a quick, cheap bite. Otherwise, there are better places to eat.  Food: 3  I ordered a taco de cabeza, lengua, and suadero. I was not a fan of the suadero because the meat is a little stringy, but the cabeza and lengua were tender. The corn tortilla was too soft and falling apart.  In respect to other eateries on the strip, you can't get much cheaper than Tacos El Gordo. But if you have time, off strip food is way cheaper and tastier. Plus, if you come from a place with an abundance of Mexican food like me, you're better off waiting until you get home where a taco is half the price and at least as tasty.  Service: 4  Tacos El Gordo has an interesting concept for ordering. There are signs pointing to where you should line up depending on what you want. Once you have your food, you go to the front counter to pay.  The lines weren't too long when I came because it was a weekday night, but I'm sure it moves fast even if it were long. The cooks work at a rapid pace.  Ambiance: 4  The restaurant is decently clean and well-lit, and there's plenty of tables to choose from. Parking doesn't seem too bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p0rQDXI-V_CIlUbeg5BEKA.text: Honestly, not worth the wait. The tacos were okay. Not bad, but nothing special. These are comparable to taco truck tacos. And I know taco truck tacos.  The asada fries were great. If you made it past the 1 hour wait OUTSIDE, reward yourself with some fries.  The 2 stars are not solely for the food, but for the service.  I was disappointed. I still am.

smsToGpOZywIt_mXAZXuVA.text: It was okay .... Guess it might be just a hype.  Had many better ones at the food trucks...

lyHKhSqPP1n09qPs9T__LA.text: Great tacos!!!! Al Pastor is definitely the best with thier guacamole sauce. Wait in line definitely worth it.

vYA4Vj_XXVM3eZ9wj97yAw.text: Came today which is Monday around 8 or 9 and it was super packed!!! There is about 3 different lines and each line has the different types of tacos to order. Also they basically are cooking the food right in front of you which is super cool because you see how fast they whip everything up. I ordered two tacos de pastor and an order of carne asada fries and it was so delicious ! Expect the place to be packed because the food is so good!! I was wondering why the carne asada fries were 13 bucks and it's because the box it comes in is huge! Literally can feed for sure 2-3 people ! Will definitely be coming back when I come out to Vegas again !

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos de pastor y carne Asada fries

aWikTT9zuSC83EQQNJnlJA.text: Tacos El Gordo is a must when I come to Vegas I'm not a first timer so I already know the deal I highly recommend the Asada and Tripa tacos they are served in front of you and they put guacamole, salsa and onions and cilantro on a warm freshly made evil hand made tortilla bomb.... also the tripa tacos are cooked to crispness perfection and also with the handmade tortillas and the salsa is really good the al pastor tacos are okay to me but also good, I didn't give it a five stars because there are a lot of flies trying to fight you for the tacos and there restroom are dirty but tacos are bomb.

YTkJVYWtWe_JZ3fT1fTDww.text: I dont know what the hype is about this place. The tacos are over rated and expensive. Service was ok

lfMiUJvJuGBFHb03O-5z7g.text: As of September 2018 the line is about 1 hr 25min till you get your food, and this place it's been open for years now! So this is the normal, which is odd for an authentic looking taco stand style restaurant right across the street from Wynn and Encore! But I guess, the key is "authentic Mexican", I would say more than their just N of the border location, and they make everything in front of you and put them together on a small plate that you walk away with, and pray to heavens that you find a table! But the tacos are awesome, try them all if you can, the Vampiro Is my favorite! Ask for grilled peppers and green onions, also get as many radishes you can from the salsa bar. It's a fun experience, more fun than gambling!

OdEJT4RaDf5sLCuOGgGw9Q.text: It's not what is was before. Tacos El Gordo was a must for me every time I was in Vegas...now, I will not return or recommend. I was there on Monday with my family, and it was their first time. I kept telling them how good it was, how they would transport to TJ the moment they walked in, and what a disappointment. My kids didn't even finish their food and neither did I. I ended up eating the meat with a fork because the tortilla was nasty, and cold by the time I sat down. The meat had no flavor and neither did the salsas. I ended up adding lemon and salt to find some taste. I noticed they are opening another location and closing the original spot. I hope the new place has better quality food...

E2eFVggGoI32rDA7hsZFoQ.text: My fiance is staying at the Wynn for Summer League. He decided to try this place because of the good reviews. WRONG DECISION. He had one Vampiro and it was death by taco the rest of the day/evening. I had to write this review for him because he's feeling like sh*t (No pun intended) FOOD POISONING!! STAY AWAY if you want to continue to enjoy your stay in Vegas.

9aDPBzk4OlUR67XPXxmPTQ.text: The tacos here are soooooo yummmm I recommend to come here you won't regret it I swear

RKsMh5vnSuJW4cCHZeC6Cw.text: If you want authentic tacos, go here! Amazing street tacos. The el pastor is out of this world.

JkO-K8ahaVfIHwz_gPZiGA.text: Came here for a quick late night bite. I was surprised how crowded it was so I thought it would be as good as yelp says. My friend and I tried a bunch of tacos because we weren't sure what to get. So we had the beef tongue, the beef shoulder, the beef stomach, and the carne asado. I personally only liked the carne asado. My friend absolutely loved the beef shoulder for some odd reason and went back for seconds. The price was so cheap but I was a bit disappointed because it wasn't what I expected. Maybe I'm just used to chicken and shrimp tacos. But at least I can say I tried all these weird tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n1Hy-ZBPxkiYAfhkU-kkKQ.text: Came in here and it was extremely crowded as was expected. I stood in line and ordered suadero tacos for myself with everything. Order was perfect. When I ordered some for my husband however, I asked for only cilantro and salsa. He gave us cilantro and onions. My husband asked him to fix it, and the employee was extremely rude and said it was my fault I ordered it wrong. It is extremely loud in here, so he must've not heard me correctly, but for him to blatantly blame me instead of kindly fixing us new tacos was out of line. It seemed like such a hassle for him to fix HIS mistake. The tacos were good, the service not so much.

4rFZnByfxrxlY2nd8c4DKA.text: Authentic flavors! I love the simplicity! Plenty of seating for sure. The service was very friendly!! We had the carne' asada tacos!! All deliciousness!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onions and cilantro
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne&#39; asada tacos on soft and crispy corn tortillas!! Excellent!!!

_mkZi8DYyVbfHM-6uNymCQ.text: Tacos were not worth the line.. I do not see what the hype is. You have to stand in different lines for different kinds of tacos - annoying! It was not the cleanest... with the crazy crowds they get, they really need someone to be walking around wiping everything, but it's just pretty dirty. Also, it's difficult to find seating.. even outside.

c-pABEJlmAtWN9pEwW15Vw.text: Most popular location just north of the Encore casino. Weekends nights will have lines out the door so prepare to wait 30min or longer.   One thing I've noticed is that Adobada and Al Pastor is the same thing. Everything here leans towards the saltier side and Asada didn't have flavor either.   Maybe we came here on a off night, but for the value and location you can't beat El Gordo. But if you have a car go off strip and try other taco shops.   They do hand roll their tortillas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DgaUu9TQNzihXq7-ohwG0w.text: Only reason I rated 2 stars is because I hate that they technically close at 145am. Ppl will rush and for nothing

TH72GrymBRMIcHW94bLJ1g.text: Adobada tacos Adobada/carne asada fries  Dammit!!! Its so good, I'm glad I don't live near one!! I'm sad that I don't!!!   If you're in Vegas, you have to try this place out! Your tummy will thank you!

C3o9O8L8gjr_nS1ty0UORA.text: Ahhhhmazing! Best asadero tacos!! The sauce and onion cilantro mix make these tacos bomb! A must have.

1VNB8lXSrNDiPjgRYLaRsA.text: Being that me and my husband are from out of town, we got on Yelp and found this place. This was the best decision we made our whole trip. If you go here you won't be disappointed, the lines may be long but it's worth the wait, I promise!

NhMm-hVBt20G2bT8bjo8Vg.text: This is where I fell in love with authentic tacos and the fries are heavenly. If you are visiting Vegas this is a great place to eat but be ready for a line. It was around 2 in the morning Vegas time and my husband and I had to wait an hour in line to get to our food. It was nice getting to know people in the process. Lots of locals. Total Dive. Get the tacos and the fries. The prices are phenomenal as well. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CH1e6TCcKAk8VftKbpuEQQ.text: Glad this location opened back up. Best Carne Asada fries!! Also, best Pork tacos I have ever had. Yummy!!

iLBqR_cqj_zdeoBoRMixUw.text: I had their spicy pork tacos. Every other bite had chunks of fat that I didn't care for. It's ok.

t_k4RY3p2MACW899b61LLA.text: Always a staple whenever we're in Vegas. Its perfect for a cheap meal, late night meals, and hangover cures.  I've pretty much only had the tacos and carne asada fries here. I usually never order horchata but here, it's not even an option for me. Yes please!  Walking in, newcomers usually have a problem learning how everything works. You have to stand in different lines for different types of meat. Pork (adobada) line, carne asada line, lengua line etc. After you order and take your food from the lines, then you walk to the cashier to pay. If you're smart, you stand in one line and your friend stands in another line.   The tacos are a great size and they're about 2 bucks each. I don't care what your preference is here, if it's your first time, you HAVE to try the spicy port Adobada tacos with everything on it!

s2r-32m_heJaPPkzhijgVA.text: Went there on Monday 12/1 was closed.... Red tent taped off with yellow tape. Anyone know what happened?...love this place was looking forward to having lunch there...

CkTiw4nCQCfhs-c_JLM-Kw.text: Sorry these tacos were terrible. Worst street tacos I have ever had!  The carne asada meat was burnt and very salty. What a disappointment. I cant even finish eating them, they are so bad. I have no idea how this place has 4+ stars. It deserves zero stars!

gYs1xMzPQRPXdq9ygP4bvg.text: Spicy pork taco with that creamy sauce is amazing!!  I'm a sucker for good street tacos. I guess that's what happens living in LA. It's become a comfort food for me. This place is all the way north of the strip, near Encore. We took a taxi because it was 109 degrees outside and I sure as heck didn't feel like walking from Vdara.  Now, this place is legit. And their system is great. Meat. Line. Meat. Line. Pay. We got 3 carne asada tacos, 3 spicy pork tacos and 1 sesos taco (beef brains). We loved the spicy pork and the creamy sauce that came with it. It also had a bit of a kick, but not crazy spicy. Actually it could've been spicier. It was delicious. Carne asada was smoky and had a delicious charred flavor. Came with some guac too, which I love on tacos. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Sesos was off, texture wise. It was too squishy and soft, kind of reminded me of chicarrons.   They have orange bang too!!! Yum!! The lines move quickly since there's 2 areas. Each taco is $2 simple and easy. Loved all the flavors. Definitely an awesome local spot!

V524L85ygrjmjHavjdDGhw.text: Do you want to taco about good tacos?!? This place is pretty amazing the wait gets fairly long on occasion but who can really complain, the tacos are amazing.

PBtI9HnHp2CnT_t2Nu8Lyg.text: We all know how the restaurant closed for a year, but now its back! Well that is about as exciting as I can make it sound because the food just isn't the same as before the closure. There is a salsa bar and previously I never had to use any salsa because the great Mexican flavors spoke for themselves without any help from the salsa bar, but now there just isn't that flavorful seasoning that kept me coming back nearly once every week. The one noticeable improvement is the carne asada taco in which the quality of the meat is much I improved over the previous fatty version. The price per taco is now $2.10 so they increased the price by 10 cents, but who cares? A feature that is no longer there is the huge red tent where you could dine outside and enjoy your food on the Law Vegas strip. Also new is the armed guard that is protecting diners from attacking taco thieves and it's a comforting feeling to know my tacos are safe. Who knows? one night there could be quite a show in addition to your meal, yay! Bueno? no gracias.

yhYAzxWtZMp-U6e1rRdogg.text: Right smack on the Strip! Perfect for after a night of clubbing & drinking. We actually came for dinner before the club. There was a hugeass line. Each line serves a different kinda meat. I enjoyed the tripas and the spicy pork! Very tasty tacos but......... I ended up having food poisoning afterwards and yacking everything out. =( The tacos did tasted good though so I will return next time to give it another chance.

0_57nqHbBydvMXIre-pyOg.text: BEST TACO EVER!   Adobada Pork!  Ask for extra salsa.  Ask for the plate of veggies.  EVEN BETTER WHEN DRUNK!  Right next to the Wynn. They had live music at around 2am...!  So SooooooOOOOooo GOOOOD!  -Give it a try!

C-nQOX6l1Fz3etLtwLwmFg.text: An amazing lunch.  Out for a stroll and looking for lunch when I find this place.  I had no idea what I was in for - amazing street tacos.  I had a steak and a spicy pork, ate those and then ordered two more of the pork.  While not a cheap street taco, with horchata I spent $10 for lunch, which is not bad for Vegas.  Even better that it was for fabulous tacos.  Love the flavors!  I need to go back and try the tongue...

eI369qepZr6Kv0Msxz9lSw.text: Why did I only find out about this place on my last day!!  This place is legit and conveninetly located right outside the Wynn!!!  They are definitely doing tacos justice, served with care and attention to detail.  It looks like a place that was picked up right out of Tijuana so don't expect a classy place, but it doesn't matter because your their for the food.  Their pork tacos are phenomenal, moist and juicy, and I'm pretty sure the only place I've seen serve tacos from a rotating gyro-like spit, which are cut freshly as you order.  Also, don't forget to get the roasted peppers.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco al pastor
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos and a quesadilla

0W72ap9AYzYeTfYWQN-2iA.text: I'm definitely definitely excited that this place came back to the same location it was before. It's now close by all over again and I can't wait to eat tacos after the club tonight. On second thought I'm gonna go before and after the club. Lol

p0hD12IPlSRmoEp4W6FD-A.text: Very busy, crowded but worth the wait. The BBQ pork taco is delicious. Carne Asada fries was good as well. Would definitely come back again when I visit Vegas.

l6D_GddeCc51JVgbB1hklQ.text: I ordered asada tacos. The guacamole was good they need to cut the meat more it was to big also they put the onions in big pieces.

-FC2vHpH02JORf2kE0xFgw.text: Being from California we've had all kinds of Mexican food so with all the great reviews we were expecting this to be up there with some of the best. Between the four of us we had a mixture of different items. Everyone agreed the carne asada was pretty plain even with all the toppings. The al pastor was down right though! Perfect flavor and moist. A cilantro sauce on top was really good. All in all the place is good but a little expensive for just tacos.

ixRDfWaGaiuk3xGZy3KC9Q.text: The hype is so real and truly one of the best taco places I've had. Sober me can wholeheartedly vouch for this! Asada and al pastors are always my go to's here. The line is usually long, but moves rather quickly. Although during the summertime, it feels like an eternity since there is no shade and you feel like you're going to be cooked alive any second. Seating in the restaurant is not that great since it's always packed, so have someone snag a table while someone else orders los tacos. You can always count on me to dine here every sin city visit!

kum2hHQOwSsmsD_oKCJHmg.text: These are the worlds best tacos. Well worth the long lines. Make sure you order more than you think you'll eat!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asada tacos
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WxVHOKeUHnFKcKjhA972iA.text: After high rollers, we came here for lunch.  Wow the tacos are amazing here.  We had so much and I was so full.  The carne asada was nice but that pork was super delicious.  The line was long but not too bad.  The tough part was finding a table to sit at.   Once we located one (we had a big group) we scarfed down on the delicious tacos and had a great time enjoying some delicious Mexican food.  The fries too were delicious.  I was very happy with this spot.  Its a good spot to come through after drinking at an open bar.   I'd definitely return again to this spot.  Great food.  PS, this is their other location.  The initial one we went to had a huge line.

2FU62zv26XpHU4Pn55MAbA.text: Tacos el Gordo is on the smaller side. There is additional outdoor seating. I ordered the carne asada (steak) tacos only. They were a decent size, the asada was flavorful. My wife had the adobada tacos and chorizo taco. She would not recommend the chorizo tacos because it was over cooked and bland. They have a soda machine as well as can drinks. Orange bang is a must with tacos!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t_PVDx2WDu6-Ri3icEu_ag.text: These are the best tacos ever! One of my highlights of coming here is the spit roasted pastor, their grilled onions and nopales and avocado sauce, SUCH a delicious, flavorful and satisfying meal, not to mention affordable. The pastor fries will easily feed two, portions are generous and the service is wonderful. Highly recommended!

e2JDZBHoO1GU2yUWX2BKlQ.text: If there was an overrated portion of our Vegas visit, it would be this one. Food was good, but the crazy amount of lines for this place make it like the best food in the world. The reality is, I've had better tacos in other places.  We waited about 45 minutes for Carne Asada tacos and they were pretty good. Got some of the pastor tacos, and those were good too. Everything was good, but nothing jumped out as being exceptionally good. Also, portions are on the small side. I guess it's hard to complain with the prices they charge compared to other places on the strip.  I will definitely be back if I'm ever in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Tacos are legit!

yu5WovdyT0fGRSAh_FhUkQ.text: Tacos were pretty tasty, but they have a stupid system and lines were ridiculous. What makes it worse is that the strip location has two stores within a block of each other, but one is closed. Why would it be closed when there is a line one hour long?   The system? Well, there is a line for different types of meat. So if you want a variety like I usually get, you have to wait in 3 different lines! The al pastor line was pretty quick, which was curious because I thought it was their specialty, but it was pretty average if you ask me. I think the meat is cooked on the flat top more than the spit due to lines, which makes it average in flavor. The other line is for meat like lengua and buche, which is what I also wanted. Now these were better than average and would go back for these. Arguably the best tacos and slowest line was for carne asada. If it were the longest line due to the flavors, it might be forgiven but it's just slow. Took an hour to get our food. What a pain. Adding insult to injury, there is yet another line to pay and get drinks. WTF? Retarded. So many people were confused and in wrong lines making things worse.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos de al pastor, lengua, and buche. Would wait another 30 mins for asada. ugh!
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crowd from inside
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The line

9Z0gGdrsvqAYDjszyjm1cQ.text: A friend of mine told me about this place. I thought Tacos. I've had plenty of 'the best' in the last 8 months. How good could it be. Than another friend of mine came to visit. He used to live here & told me this is where we immediately have to go. And off we went....  O.H. M.Y. G.O.D.!!! Yes hands down the most tasty, delicious, flavorful, beautiful, amazing, taco I have had. I don't like the corn tortillas & it didn't matter because they have flour as well. I took my friend twice over the several days he was here. Spicy Pork was my favorite & my buddy's favorite was the Carne Asada Fries. Grossly delicious!   The price is inexpensive,  the atmosphere is nice, the restaurant is so clean it was sparkling, everyone wears gloves, most people speak English (Spanish is the first), & it is always packed.   I can't wait to go back since it's not very far & I always pass it at least once a day. See you soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

luQVPoEFW_c3PpXcV78QfQ.text: Our Uber recommended this place to us and it was worth the walk down the strip!  We don't speak Spanish but were able to navigate the menu just fine and land ourselves some absolute authentic flavorful tacos!!    The pork tacos were by far the shining star, and I could watch the guy slicing the pork off the giant pork stacked carousel dripping in juice all day!  He was a master at it and it was an art!    The steak tacos were very good too with a slab of fresh, creamy guacamole, and freshly sliced steak.     We also tried the steak Azteca which was delicious.  Loved feeling like we stepped into Tijuana!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Azteca
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delicious!

eo_16yiJJ2SLPFMTOQVDCw.text: Just yum is all I can say. This place is the real deal!  The tortillas are made from scratch and cooked fresh and the meat is marinated and cooked there. I'm in Vegas quite often and had never heard of it until my cousin told me. We went and I was pleasantly pleased. It's a bit of a wait and experience. You have to know what you want and there are separate lines for things. The workers there have a system and they get the food out pretty fast. Now that I've found this place, I've been back since my first visit and I'll make a stop there in future visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El pastor!  yum!
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uMYJezhIkcXmmZ1bn1qrOQ.text: Big taco fan.   As a UCSD alum, I was absolutely obsessed with the one in San Diego, and the one in Vegas is a must-go every time I'm there. I could care less about going to the clubs, just let me get my tacos PLEASE.  Adobado is the best, although I do also like carne asada a lot. Everytime I'm here, I eat what should be my entire diet for the week LOL. I always get adobado, although I tell myself I should try to be more adventurous.   The tacos are $2.40 each, which I believe is more expensive than they are in SD? Or maybe they've raised their prices; anyways, the point is that tacos are not on the cheap end. Still worth though.  Love the laid back vibe. The workers here are pretty friendly and generous with what they give. My coworkers and I came here recently and asked for a TON of pineapple slices and jalapenos last time, and they obliged without any complaints or weird looks.   I also think they made another location? Not completely sure, but I saw another Tacos El Gordo like a block away, so maybe they opened another one for crowd control purposes because usually, the line be long af. BUT STILL WORTH.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. all these adobado tacos for me muahahahahaha

qMNc-aB4_wSQHHdFnEZK3w.text: Be prepared to wait for these simple yet delicious tacos. We showed up at midnight and waited in line approx 30 minutes. Tacos El Gordo has several lines once inside although, you must choose the correct line depending on the type of meat you want. We shared el pastor & pork tacos along with fries and a drink.  Both were great but the pork was our favorite! This is the beat of Mexican street food with indoor and outdoor seating. We can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KzeDS7V3Gp-KTufrFYzDdg.text: Just a Hype.  I can only speak for the AlPastor.  I had the tacos with the Green sauce (Guacamole????). The Meat reminds me of the BBQ pork you get at a Chinese Fast Food joint, it taste and looks the same.  I can even probably swear that the meat has some sort red food coloring.  A real alPastor has natural marinade/Chile sauce that give it its taste.  This meat does not have flavor.   The green (guacamole ?) sauce is sweet and runny which Is why I say it's not Guacamole.  Yes, I did eat the tacos but that's because I was hungry and I don't like to waste food. I've definitely had better AlPastor tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AlPastor Tacos

n3Gv9QN0BDq9OA6o50_0Eg.text: The pros: Very good pastor meat They prepare right In front of you  Homemade tortillas  Good flavors  Decent prices for tacos  place is clean  The CONS: The guys that prepare the tacos not very friendly, and Prepare your food as if they're running a contest against each other!!  super fast and sloppy.   Place very small for such a popular restaurant - hot and stuffy inside.  Having to get in individual meat lines to order  Very confusing for the first time.  Carne Asada fries over rated and expensive.  You're not able to put your own condiments afterwords- So what you get while waiting in each individual meet line is really WHAT YOU GET  UNLESS back and less you want to stand in line again.

0AoBAYMXxfHFVLVLw8UJcQ.text: Tacos El Gordo is alright. I mean I come from East LA and we got a lotta good tacos out here so I'd give them a solid 3-4 stars.   I ordered the asada tacos and mula, the tacos were alright, enjoyed the handmade tortilla, but the meat was a little too dry to my liking. Also the pricing?? Not sure about you but I don't really know how to feel about tacos that cost more than $1.50..   Mula was quite delicious but difficult to eat as the filling would keep falling out of the tortilla sandwich.   The worst part of my dining experience here was the WAIT. I arrived around 8 and literally waited 50 minutes what appeared as a small 15-20 person line just to order tacos! It seems that the takeout line gets priority so would recommend that you call in ahead of time.   Otherwise decent tacos but unreasonable wait. Not familiar with the Vegas food scene so could be better options out there.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JLGvVsHxHQBu67i1_i83uA.text: Amazing amazing tacos. The line was super long and it is confusing to navigate unless A. You've been there before or B. You speak Spanish. Luckily for me I spoke Spanish and was able to figure out the lines. If there is a long line out the door, there is only one line. However, the line splits up inside to different kinds of meat. There are two Al Pastor lines, one Asada line and one line with Lengua, Cabeza, the works. It's hard to come here by yourself if you want to have multiple tacos. I recommend coming with someone else to split up and stand in separate lines.   The Lengua and the works line was the one I stood in. Let me tell you, it is three times slower than the Al Pastor line. They only had one guy cutting up all sorts of meat at a time. If you wanted Lengua, Cabeza or another meat as well you can expect to wait super duper long.   All in all, thought, I would one hundred percent come again. The tacos were fresh and delicious, but I would not wait in line for the Lengua. I have had better Lengua elsewhere and would just focus on filling my tummy with the Al Pastor.

EZVsiIDwGs5lsXw4hq4bqw.text: As most of my reviews are based on, white cloth and candlelight table service that garners 5 stars, this place was upon first impressions to me was, "What the heck have I gotten myself into". A corner joint with a line out the door that seemed a mile long.  Why am I waiting on this line for a taco???  Upon finally entering the doors we are directed to specific line that corresponds with the type of food we will be ordering.  This is not to my liking.  My wife orders, that way I don't get flustered.    Ok, after reading my first two paragraphs you may wonder why I'm giving 4 stars because so far it sure doesn't sound like a 4 star.  Well, upon diving into these types of tacos that I cannot pronounce I will tell you that my mouth was exploding with Wonderful, Bursting, Flavor that was not what my pallet was expecting.  Forget grading on a white table scale.  Taste alone sets this place apart.  4 strong stars.  Not 5 because I feel the system they have set up of individual lines for specific items of food was ridiculous and you really did have to wait an out of this world amount of time.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Py9hWetvPV6ZP7cfi5f8Q.text: Note there are 2 locations next to each other. This spot is pretty good! We came in at 2am on a Saturday night and there was a pretty decent wait. Luckily, there were 3 of us so 2 got in line and I went to grab a table. It's not too small with plentiful seating and room for the ever growing line. The steak is moist but not flavorful. The pork is where it's at, it was juicy and full of flavor. The tortillas are made fresh and perfect so there is no need for 2. The vampiro was good, cheesy and hot. All in all it was good and I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XGIdcxk2kFfpB1CrBYJsiA.text: BOMB! I wish I could eat more tacos, I had 3 and it was only 2.50 each!! The drinks are also refillable. There wasn't any line when we came here to fuel up before a pool party and we loved it. Its right across the street from Encore Beach Club!   The lines for different types of tacos are separated so it moves pretty quickly! Super casual but amazing tacos. I'm definitely coming back the next time I'm in Vegas. They have plenty of seating inside and out.

WxA2gPN2G9Bi8uMLNQDdhw.text: Perfect stop after a night of running around Vegas and drinking. Closest to Tijuana tacos for sure. The mulas are so good!!! Carne asada very soft and lots of flavor! Will come here every time we're in town! Always busy but fast moving lines, worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1-3-18

R7Zgl2sg9830rQBGJ27dLg.text: Great food. Tacos are simply awesome. Inexpensive delicious food. 2nd time here while on vacation. I'd recommend this spot to anyone for a quick bite to eat.

eZnX1M6gJRaNFe0ILCASbA.text: A really fantastic taco.  Efficient & delicious.  I've eaten at 3 of their locations.  The food here was good, but not quite on par with the El Cajon location (now closed).  I'll say this, even a mediocre Tacos el Gordo taco bests 99% of another taco.  They're my favorite taco, and I'm nearly sure they'll be yours.  I honestly wouldn't miss the chance to eat here.  It's an authentic taste of real Tijuana tacos, without the fuss (or beheading) of a boarder crossing.   I highly recommend you hit them up, for what's likely to be the best taco you've ever had.  Start with 4... but be ready for 6+... bring your stretchy pants people.

AINoGufTc-ajNEnSg8LQnw.text: This place is always bomb if you come almost all the time their is a big line but their mulitas are the best you gotta try those everyone is friendly the cooks are amazing and funny they are always positive when they help you and take you're order their was one cashier that was a B*%!H but she must not like her job oh well but I sure love their food lol

UoDToJCxO6_EA2Fpq2yYsQ.text: this place it makes you feel like seat in a local restaurent at Mexico city! Hahaha! Fast and nice food!

76dR7UxE3wrUVLV9Z-IHyw.text: Was playing poker at Encore and was recommended this place by another player. Walked over and was very happy with authentic street taco experience. Can't wait to go back

zotyDWPuC8GmK4FTorteHg.text: This taco spot on the Vegas strip was actually really good and authentic. But there are always the pros and the cons....  Pros:   - Handmade tortillas! Yes! You can see the lady actually making them right in front of you while you order.  - The fam all ordered asada tacos and they were really good. Lots of flavor and they add guacamole. They don't skimp on the meat either!  - They have a fountain machine so that's convenient.   - Prices are pretty decent considering their location.  Cons:   - Line was long consistently.  - Not much seating. Mostly inside with a few outside.   - When we first went in, the whole place inside was so smokey that the employees had to open up the doors to air it out. So watch out asthmatics!   - There's no salsa bar! They have a bar for lime, radish, etc., but no salsa and I was not going to wait in that line again.   Overall, I think the pros outweighed the cons. I'll definitely be coming back! You

Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Handmade tortillas. Yum!

RbAC8cAeRKnLsSvPlfW_gw.text: This place is probably a 5 min walk from Encore. When we got there around 10 pm, there was a huge line. However, the lines are separate per station so be sure to make sure you're in the right line. The carne asada lines were out the door but the adobada al pastor lines were much shorter and started inside the restaurant so we decided to go there. You pick how many tacos you want while they shave the pork right in front of you with freshly  made tortillas. These tacos are pretty small so make sure you order enough! After you get your food, you pay at the counter and then you are ready to eat. The tacos are delicious! There was the right amount of spice and seasoning on the al pastor and the tortilla had perfect texture. I will definitely come back here to try the carne asada next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobada al pastor taco

ToTEiwb1hGIKgcxDpEpI5g.text: The variety of tacos is awesome they have carne asada, tripas, lengua, cabeza, chorizo,nopales. The tortillas are homemade and the salsas are yummy! They also have carne asada fries. I give it five stars as far as food goes.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars was seating is extremely limited only a few tables and it is always super packed when we have gone

9DOWwyMma_UW_zFZ6IqbiQ.text: Quality of there food has gone down alot the size of the taco you get is alot smaller from when they first started in Chula Vista Ca, taco's where alot bigger and full with meat and flavor, but seems like they reach there clientele so they did what most food chains do and cut back so they can get more profit!                       I DON'T RECOMMEND

QtmDjeQUYugZ_7yzvMayuA.text: This is the best Mexican food in Las Vegas. If the tacos taste authentic, it's because they are. This company has locations in Mexico and close to the border. You should definitely get the adobada spicy pork and the carne asada fries.   There are multiple lines each with a different selection of meats, so pay attention to the signs in the front, by the counter.

NSBmLw1CSLKf9rhSkPOSOw.text: This place has some seriously great tacos! The service is friendly especially the ladies where you pay. Most importantly the food is served fast, hot and SUPER tasty. We got 12 al pastors and 2 cheese quesadillas which hit the spot after a long day of drinking and walking. Great place will defo be back next time vist

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HgqcX5wouuawkhjikqXclw.text: Holy cow. SOOOO good. There is nothing like an authentic mexican street taco to wrap up a long day/night in Vegas.   I just wish that ordering was easier/made more sense. There are separate lines depending on what you want (Beef, Chicken, etc.), meaning you had to wait more than a few times to get all your food together.  Could do with an upgrade to how they take orders/serve food, but still 5 star taste.

tsf-c4kQhLdYVDmuoQGONw.text: I've never really been a big fan of this Tacos El Gordo, preferred the one on Charleston if anything but still not a big fan of Tacos El Gordo.  I don't know why but somehow I seem to always find myself coming here once in awhile; people do flock over to this location because its on the Strip.  Go to the Charleston location if it's busy here it's not that far away.  Honestly I like their food only when I'm either drunk or recovering  but I could probably get the same effect from a Roberto's which is probably more convenient. Any other time I just can't enjoy them.  When it's slow, which is when they're usually still busy but manageable, you can find a parking spot easily, you walk into the building, open the door and shut the door, you wait in a decent line, and you can enjoy your meal maybe on a table inside or outside.  However when it's busy, mainly weekend, forget about coming here, unless you're willing to wait. The line usually spills out the door and it's hard to find a seat.  You'll likely find yourself joining others eating their food on the curb or at your car.   Food-wise it's alright 3 star maybe 3.5 tops which isn't that bad.  You probably heard about their carne asada and adobada fries, and their various street tacos they are a must if you never had it but personally I don't think they have enough flavor to my liking and seemed a little pricey, especially for the fries. I think I only liked them the first time I've had street tacos.  It kind of has phased out of my system, I do prefer a few other businesses more.   Overall they are probably a 2 star maybe 3  mainly because of the inconvenience and madness that goes on. Yea it's busy because a lot of people want them but they could do something better to manage the crowd besides making the food faster, I don't know maybe it's just me being picky but definitely not a fan of the atmosphere. You can say it lacks good customer service but they do make things fast.  Most recently I brought some out of state family here it lasted only a few mins. We ended up going to a pretty good regular Mexican restaurant where it was fast, excellent customer service, served good food, and accomedating for a large group wiith kids, Taco Bell joking.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I want some all you can eat bbq or sushi taco el gordo.

tHu1aUvqu9j0Bo47kUls2g.text: I felt we were herded like cattle. Unfriendly staff. Make sure you're in the right line as signs are a bit confusing. Nothing extraordinary about the tacos and salsas.

n_fQLffaj5NS6ZYrYkUZSg.text: My friends hated this place and said they will never come back. I admit the meat is good but there were a lot of other things I didn't like. Through our experience, it was packed, hectic, and wasn't as great as we thought it would be. When you go in there will be lines based on meats. Everyone talks about the carne asada fries so I decided to go in the asada line. The asada line usually goes out the door. Someone was telling me to either stay outside or go in and I wanted to go in but there was no room. So by the time I ordered I wasn't sure if the guy who was making the food heard me or not. I also ordered the tacos which came immediately. So I assumed he didn't hear me and my friends were in a different line and we wanted the same thing so I decided to join them in the last line furthest to the right. My friends said they were in line for the carne asada line, but they were actually in line for the lengua line which didn't show the asada. The line for the lengua goes to a side so you can't see what the line is for until you get about half way through. Someone in line told us that we are in the wrong line. So I wanted to make sure I wasn't in the wrong line. I asked the cashier which line is for the carne asada and she didn't speak English but she understood me and pointed at the line, the line I got the tacos in. Turns out the guy did hear me and got mad at me for stepping out of line. But he was already taking other people's orders so I got confused. I felt like the whole experience was confusing. When I finally got my food, I needed napkins and had to ask where they have the napkins. Apparently they don't give you napkins you have to ask for it.  I felt like this place has poor customer service. The first cashier that helped me was ok but the second one seemed so grumpy. They are not friendly to first comers either. They just assumed that everyone knows what they are doing.  Anyway, the food ended up being just ok. The fries were soggy but the meat is pretty good.  The food was pretty salty in general and made me super thirsty. As for coming back here, I don't think I would come back unless there was nothing else opened. But it's Vegas, so probably not. It's the city that never sleeps. Maybe the grumpy cashiers just needed to sleep?

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mBu2HQN0BZ-ANw6rAb1JRg.text: Carne Asada Fries. It's all you need. Now life is complete. Life has purpose and meaning. That purpose is to have more carne asada fries which make life better.   They have a huge selection of great Mexican food but you need to try the carne asada fries! Tender flavorful meat on top of delicate fries and covered in shredded cheese, magic green sauce and just a drop of sour cream = happiness. And a 1/2 order is only $5 - big enough for 4 people!!  Located just north of the Wynn on the strip and open extremely late it's one of those Vegas secrets that make it an incredible trip.   Warning - you will want this again. Crave it. Need it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Fries!!! With extra green sauce!!!!
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Fries!!!

nJ4mu41L9F69JTbA6v-Lmw.text: They alright. Wont be my first choice to get tacos but they work. The meat is good and thr torillas are good. Chorizo and pastor are not that great. And alittle pricey

uTx7bASW_kFFmiB5z3YPVg.text: Me and my friends came to eat some tacos, they loved them. I didn't .My own opinion  they don't look appetizing. First you make line for about 20 min to order your food and get it, after you get your food you wait another 20 min to pay for your food. That's a different line. From where you get your food. By the time you start eating your food is cold. the set is annoying, chaotic, poor management skills ..I myself won't be going back.  If it was up to me. I wouldn't even give them one star.

Ih5cdezzBy2EqBrcIwuIiA.text: Pros: -Went on a Tuesday at 4pm and only stood in line for about 15 minutes. -Homemade tortillas. -Generous meat portions. -Traditional Mexican-the tortillas are dipped in oil, salsa can be spicey -Plenty of parking -Average is 2.25 for each taco  -Adobada was great!!  Cons -Asada meat needed more flavor and it was cold -The guacamole comes straight from the fridge so it made my tacos cold -Not a ton of seating  Overall, this place is a must visit when you're in Vegas, at least for the first experience. They won't be the best tacos you've tasted, but they are cheap, good and traditional. Check it out...
