_IRkuTHRiX4QxUE5YL96gw.text: Omg this tacos are good with a bit small portion of meat but good the only problem is the service super bad u dont even know where the line starts and plus u stand on different lines  to get different meat so when u do like 100 lines finally u pay n  u have to look for table n when u finally are going to eat your tacos are cold n mad because all the time u did standing up please change your service

Ty_nw-I1Qm4oXwN74G7s_Q.text: This place is amazing! I love the buche, lengua and the adobada taco. We went there twice during our 4 day weekend. I would highly suggest making a stop, won't be disappointed.

iFL69fe9VmpCSmYqqnWGrA.text: This location of Tacos El Gordo is much cleaner than Charleston store. I've been here twice after a long night on the Strip and still want to come back for more. Check their hours of operation before you come, because they do open late on Fridays and Saturdays. There aren't too many good cheap eats on the strip like this.  We always get the same things, but I'm sure that the other menu items are good too. I'd recommend the carne asada fries and al pastor tacos. You order in different lines depending on which type of meat you want, and then pay at the front cashier. Don't forget to ask them for extra red or green salsa behind the cash register. Its definitely not the best that I've had, but its pretty good to satisfy your taco cravings.

f7pZbbwQpV0rO4YQFd5y4Q.text: Good tacos. The ordering is a bit confusing and can cause some of the tacos to be not as hot when you get to the tables. The Al Pastor was better than the asada. Nice people

GZO_P9DcN2JPb9K9RQuN1g.text: The food is great! The system for ordering and paying could be much more efficient. Their lines are separated by meat selection. 2 for al pastor, one for carne asada and another for other meats. You'll usually wait in line to get in, another line to order and a third line to pay. The food is good though.

s7Z3TJ5cE8fKLyurz6kdxg.text: Some of the best tacos I've ever had. When there's whole Mexican families eating here at 2am, you know it's good. Tip: it's easier if you show up with someone that knows Spanish, to translate and/or order off the menu. I tried to order what the guy in front of me got and ended up with something completely different. Oops. Still delicious, though! (Also important to mention: I was not in an intoxicated state wherein I would anything and everything.) Also, you can google "how to order at Tacos El Gordo" and that helps a bit.

XwRMBNegugMXJa0antVBUA.text: Loved loved this place . I'm Mexican and I can say these are real Mexican tacos . So much flavor & filling !! I will keep coming here every time I'm in Vegas  I've heard people say it gets super packed but my boyfriend and I have gone around 6 and we've gone in and had our tacos and ready to eat within 10 mins . Maybe we just got lucky:) lol

ZjNWkPKNF88tilXmHFPzzA.text: Came here after the Sugar Bowl game last month because my friends wanted to try this place and they absolutely loved it. I on the other hand can't say I cared for it. I'm not saying it's terrible but it just wasn't for my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas, but it looks like a lot of other people love it so they're obviously doing something right.   Right off the bat I wasn't crazy about waiting in different lines for different tacos and then waiting again to pay so by the time I sit down my tacos aren't hot anymore. Other than that it's ok...

3zpHqGKJ3FmNXUnrbbHTuw.text: $2 a taco?!  Brought 15 tacos back to the room, had a picnic taco party on the floor while all the girls got ready for going out.  The favorites were the Asada tacos, with the Al Pastor coming in second. Lengua came in last.  Best idea ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asada. Messy Goodness.

FRAYQmsrdUtW0w0_AV2SLA.text: Great food and excellent service. If you feel like Mexican food this place is a perfect choice. But it wouldn't work if you are on the diet... The portions are huge. Lol

ZdFaRLY1_V_-UVrFcJcFjA.text: The tacos are great, but the wait is long.   We passed this place multiple times during our weekend in Vegas, and there's always a line out the door. 2 pm, 9:30 pm, 11 am. Always a line.   The food: Some of our group got pork tacos and some got beef. All were were very good! You can get the tacos with everything - cilantro, onion, salsa, and avocado, or any combination of the four. The tortillas are homemade, and the meat is freshly made. The tacos were very delicious and cheap!   The service: there was a long line out the door, but they were constantly getting through people fast! They were also offering water to people outside since it was hot! Very nice and attentive!   We did wait in line for 45 minutes, but it honestly didn't seem that long. I'd probably return, but would definitely prefer a shorter wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asada tacos

RydE-blqmRozNIUA_TniBQ.text: A hole in the wall on the strip that offers very few items which is also in Spanish  We stuck to what we knew carne Assad tacos and omg they were soo good now o know why the line wraps around th

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SlpR2llvogxaMhfbx0yTWg.text: If you want authentic tacos, this is the place. No questions about that!  However, their system is confusing and while it might speed up the individual lines, what you end up is with cold food because if what you want is to try a bit of every one of their items you are going to have to end making 4 to 5 lengthy line!  Their horchata and aguas frescas refill station is awesome, though!

E9KqCR2JaTMuyiXqzhQDqQ.text: If you like cold tacos and Never ending lines this is the place for you. People don't be fooled by the long lines. Yes usually long lines mean good food but Not in this case. In this case long lines means slow service. They suck. No idea how this place is either a four-star or a taco spot???? It does not deserve 4 stars or to even be called a Mexican taco spot.   For starters, from the time you get in line to the time you get to eat your soggy no flavor tacos a third of your day has been waisted.The way things are structured and organized there is horrible.   First you decide what type of tacos you want. Then depending on the meat you chose you get in line for then if you want a different type of meat you get in another line. Then after you are all done with your tacos you get in another line to pay. Then if you got a drink you get into another line. After you get your food and you decide to eat there you have to hunt for a place to sit so that could take another 15 to 20 minutes meanwhile your food is almost frozen. I suggest they invest in a few microwaves so people could re-warm their tacos.   I was there Labor Day weekend 2019 and I could honestly tell you that this is the worst taco spot that I've ever been to. Trust me I'm from LA and I've ate a taco or two...   Carne asada tacos had no flavor and the grilled onions and grilled jalapenos needed more time on the grill. Even my seven-year-old complained that it took forever in a day and that  all the drink lids were broken and that we should've just gone to Taco Bell!!!! LOL... I could keep going on and on about this crappy overrated place but this will just take my entire day.  If your 7 yr old is comparing them to Taco Bell you know this is bad.!!! Good luck and enjoy your time in Vegas just don't stop at this place and if you absolutely have no choice make sure you stop at Walgreens for a bottle of Pepto.

WsTNiOcb1NLx47-29rShUA.text: The adobada is the best and just like the one in San Diego. It is worth the wait. Always order one more than you think you will eat.

ej-9gE6qCdAPqIW5SaiVWg.text: Love. First time trying the Vegas location after the Chula Vista one in SoCal years prior. There are literally two stores down the street from each other because the first one was so popular. Pro tip: there is a live tv on the door of the store that shows you the line at the second location.   My faves are the more obscure meats--brain, tripe, tongue, and head. I like all of them for their rarity, but the tongue is tasty and the head is so super soft. Definitely best street tacos in California and Nevada by a long shot. The workers here hustle hard!

cLG077Tq_6UWcn4PVIj0Yw.text: This place is located in a strip mall. A tell tale sign that you are in the right place is the numerous exotic cars in the parking lot for rent. I'm talking lambos, ferraris, maclarans (sp?), etc. This eatery is located right off the main road so it's really easy to find and miss if you aren't paying attention. Also, parking is a little tight since it's a small strip mall with not a lot of parking. If you're lucky, you can just walk it. If not, parking is still pretty plentiful with people going in and out of the stores/eateries often.  Ok, so when you enter this place, there's a guard at the door. He's pretty much there so that people aren't blocking the doors and to make sure you go in and out of the correct door. Trust me, there's a ton of people who go out of the enter only door. You could just ask the guard to exit out of the entrance door. We did since we had a stroller and it was harder to get out the exit door than it was through the entrance door.  Okay, now pay attention because it gets a little confusing.  When you walk in, there are a bunch of different lines. If you look just below the menus, you will see a sign with the different items you can order from each line. Again, EACH LINE IS DIFFERENT. Don't go trying to order asada in another line that asada isn't listed because you won't get service. Also, if you order the fries, you will need to pick it up in another area of the restaurant. Again, big sign points you in the right direction. Once you get your food, proceed to the cashier which is just off of the drinks area. My suggestion is, if you are waiting for fries, just tell the cashier what you ordered (she can see it on your tray) and tell her you also ordered the fries (however you ordered it) and then she will add it to the bill and you pay right there. Once you pay, your fries should be ready at that point. Ours was.  The food is so tasty. The tacos are street tacos so they are small but delicious. The toppings are yummy. I'm a salsa girl so I eat all tacos, etc. with salsa. You can ask for salsa when you are paying for your food. The cashier has it in a refrigerator right behind them. I was actually full after having four tacos. They are small tacos but the meat is hearty and the cooks stuff them full of meat so it's a plus. My boy's quesadilla was also filled to the brim with meat. I forgot to ask for cheese on them but my boys ate them none the less. Two teenagers ate 2 quesadillas each. The other son ate the asada fries. That was delicious. It came with all the toppings. I have no idea how he ate a large order on his own but he did.  This place is super busy. If you can snag a table inside, go ahead and do so. If you can't, there's seating outside or you can just go back to your hotel or wherever you eat so that you can be comfortable. The prices are good and food is yummy in my tummy delicious. When in Vegas, we are definitely coming back here to get our taco fix. Well, and to look at the pretty cars in the parking lot.

IReYZwDPEO8uuvwssPurJw.text: Heard that this place is awesome so it was a must try!!! Parking is a little crazy being that they are on the strip.  They have moved from their old location to right across the street.    So this place is crazy busy at all times of the day!  The wait outside was about 30 min long but then there is a crazy line inside.  There are two lines inside for adobada (pork), carne asada (beef) and then single lines for brain, tongue, etc, Fries (adobada, carne asada etc).  They don't tell you how it really works, you either figure it out or you ask a customer and hopefully they help you.  Lucky my cousin was with us so we kinda got a low down.  I stood in the adobada line while my husband stood in the carne asada line to order our food.  My father in law found a table to sit at because it was crazy busy.  You grab a tray when reaching the front of the line and tell the persons what you'd like, how many tacos, sopes, quesadilla etc of that particular meat and what sauces etc you would like on it. He/she hands you your order and put out it on ur tray.  Once you grab your food you need to go to the cashier with your tray and order you drinks (they have fountain drinks and water, no alcohol) and pay for your food.   My fave was the carne asada taco.  The adobada was alright.    The staff is sooooo busy working hard but they are helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hours
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J-LbuJozHahPG6zbMDclOg.text: This place was delicious! I had 3 tacos de pastor! Around ~$2.50 each. (Being from Houston, TX - this was shockingly pricey to us...tacos in Houston are usually $1 )...They are small tacos but very filling since they double up on the tortillas. There are plenty of other things on the menu to choose from. Give it a try! Right across the street from Encore beach club.

CxCPZD9D3hC52lK9ZtIkAA.text: Vegas Tacos Go To.   For 3 day's in a row Sunday - Tuesday I saw this placed packed! Lines formed down the block. As early as 10am until later in the afternoon.   There is a reason for sure why this place is so popular. Not your average tacos! The meat is nice and tender and cooked perfectly. The sauce/salsa is outstanding. Mini bar available to add additional condiments. Can and fountain drinks available. The tacos are on the smaller side so if your hungry, order plenty or get you an order of their rather large portion size unique fries. Great plus to the tacos is the fact that the tortillas are hand made fresh! Yum! that always takes tacos to another level. I believe you can order an order of plain tortillas both corn or flour. The fries are a nice twist to a great street style taco. Very large portions. A small order is more than enough for 2 people, you may even stretch it to 3 people. A mouth full of flavor!   The downside and why I knocked a star down is due to their order system. I heard people complaining and with good/understandable reason. My tacos were cold when I ate them. They have several sections of which you get in line depending what you want to order. Between 2 people having to jump to two separate lines each, it was almost not worth the wait & process. If it wasn't because the food tasted so good even half cold, I would have passed on Gordo's. There are plenty of employee's of which they work fast! However the actual system and the amount of people creates a sloppy mess. On top of waiting in line for whatever food you want, you then have to wait until your whole order is complete to get in another long line to pay. Unless you want to make multiple purchases, that's another option...I was proud of my patience despite being very hungry.   No chorizo available (fan of chorizo).

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YcFU0PxdGhQiwkUbcGYCBA.text: This is probably my favorite Taco Shop in Vegas!  I come here every year for the Furniture market and it is a MUST STOP ! My favorite are the pastor tacos, but I decide to switch it up this time and got asada fries... Definitely made the right choice!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos al Pastor &amp; Asada Fries
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asada Fries !

HpB7oIDNv_f_FuvZaMJPqA.text: OMG this place is outstanding!!!!!! The food is delicious and priced very reasonable for the strip.  I highly suggest anyone who loves Mexican food to try this place.  The line can get very long especially late night around 2am when everyone pours out of the encore nightclub and is looking for some greasy food to eat so come early.

EnBlkRgb-Uj8zcipNwZTIA.text: Delicious, authentic tacos with that homemade taste that you expect from your abuela. Or in my case since I'm Asian, my friends' abuelas.   It was a great stop after leaving Encore Beach Club, which is walking distance. If you want a lot of tacos with different meats, you may have to wait in multiple lines. Or divide and conquer if you come with a lot of friends. I like the green sauce that comes with the al pastor tacos.  I can see why a lot of people make it to Tacos El Gordo when they're in town. Will definitely be back to try every meat available!

6E03vH3hHwEngI2jZeTK_A.text: Tortillas are made fresh. The restaurant is located at the of the strip and can get very busy at times.  They have some of the best carnitas tacos I've ever eaten in my life. Worth the wait always.

ZcfT1Q3BhjsE9HB9Qj7y4A.text: One of my favorite places to check out if I am ever on this side of the strip.   There is always multiple lines for Adobada and now the lines & wait are even better with the second location opened (right across the plaza).   I always ask for grilled pineapple, depending on the day they may give you strips or chop it up.

15uR1wJN-lh8eHuZBgtZLw.text: Love this place !! Except ur tacos get cold while U wait on a different line ,to get a different choice of meat ,but u can't leave Vega without trying there tacos !

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xgrn2ATktNTSS4Hp3Ty4hA.text: So, wanted some Mexican food and to my surprise we did a drive by and went in.  The people are very helpful as I had no idea what was what.  And even the customers were friendly and explain things.  Most of them all spoke spanish and they told you what was good to eat.    We ordered the steak tostadas and tacos for safe choices and then did some off the path stuff like brain and tongue, which was not bad.  We also got some pork tacos which were pretty good.    What I really liked was they make the corn tortillas from scratch and right there on the grill.  They add cilantro, onions, and guacamole to the tacos and for the mystery meat they put some green sauce on it.    Price was about $2.45 for one order of tacos (two street style tacos) and the same serving size for the tostadas.   It's very much a diner like place where it's kind of loud and its clean. The soft drinks are self service and they do have your array of mexican drinks.    Overall, it was decent and I would go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y0cr-96Y4-P5016dyWQUOw.text: Was really excited to try this place looks super authentic from the inside and outside.  You order at the counter than walk to the other side pick up your foot than head over to cashier to pay and get your drinks.  We ordered a couple of tostadas, and tacos.  Their pastor which they simply call pork looked beautiful roasting on the spit with pineapple on the top.  However, it tasted more like Chinese BBQ pork.  The tortilla and salsa they used was good, but they add it for you and it frankly needed more.  We tried the tostadas with the beef head meat.  The beef head was quite tender, had good flavor, the tostada was a little hard and stale.  Again not enough salsa.  My son had a quesadilla, which there version is a bit different it comes open with a crunchy tortilla.  The reason for the extra point off, my wife ordered no onions and they put onions on every taco, and wife speaks fluent Spanish.  Also the place was full of mosquitoes, I can usually tolerate a few here and there but this was bad, they need to step up their cleaning.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco pastor, tostadas with beef head, tacos Asada.
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordering counter

T_fCwINVHwi6EYcSUv5iOA.text: BEST STREET TACOS!! This is by far my favorite taco place in Las Vegas. I recommend the Carne Asada tacos, fries, and the orange cream soda!  Be ready to move quickly because the lines do move fast and there are lines for specific meats and a line just for fries.  The establishment is very well ran and the employees are extremely friendly and helpful.   Go enjoy you some authentic tacos while in Vegas!

gADHUDIRHUgkyhNqcs2DSw.text: When you first pull up, your first impression is "No way, that is a long line.!" Let me tell you, it is well worth the wait. The tacos are delicious. Home made and original taste. The tortillas are handmade and the salsas that they use are very tasteful, not spicy at all but with an amazing taste. The AlPastor is always my go to, which was a perfect choice ordering it here. Extremely juicy and the blend of everything (meat, onions, cilantro, salsa, and a cream guacamole) is perfection. The Asada was my second best, although the meat slices are a bit on the thick side. Highly recommend. Will satisfy your cravings.!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AlPastor &amp; Asada taco with everything.
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asada with the guacamole, AlPastor with the cream guacamole.

gN69mGX3dydDL15kdw6INg.text: This place is perfect if you're looking for casual cheap eats. Prices are reasonable. The only downside is the line is usually long. You also need to wait on separate lines for what you want to order. The lines differ from the type of meat you want for your tacos, quesadilla, etc. Half order of the carne asada fries is sharable with 3 people, unless you're only getting fries then get the full order to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h1FLNI1sYR3QbM0LeFNN-A.text: So...place is overhyped. I get it. Tacos. Carne Asada fries. Good stuff but not great. Would only come after a night of clubbing and my drunk self needing that late night food. Tacos are good and carne asada fries take too long considering the French fries are frozen and the end product that is the fries are not well presented. Cheese sprinkled on top doesn't even melt. Whelp. System for getting food is poor in my opinion. Can't get two Asada tacos and my lengua tacos. Two different lines resulting in a pair of tacos getting cold while you wait for the others.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asada tacos
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada fries

NyOwSvQ4EJ_5nRKyS6DEig.text: Here is my review.  There is no better taco place in all of America.  Trust me.  Go.  Eat some tacos.  Thank me via Yelp.   What did I learn today?  You're welcome.

ZLCBWYgoucGxcgNQ-1bbbA.text: Al pastor is the way to go.  Tortillas are smaller than the asada tacos, but the ratio of tortilla to carne is great.  Pastor isn't cooked with charcoal, but still had solid flavor.  Inexpensive and delicious!

baTIP5_4lcx2KTXHPQmAMw.text: Interesting twist on the taco here...  Kinda like a Mexican Gyro where they slice off meat from a rotating spit.    Flavor wise it was just ok.  It seems pretty popular though so I'm probably in the minority here but it just missed the mark.    The best thing for me was the Orange Bang they had at the soda dispensers.  Haven't seen that in since Pioneer Chicken was around.    Give The Gordo a shot though and try it for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GJ3fKVR_Lr1b_T9LK-nOUQ.text: I finally had a chance to try the famous TJ tacos. Get the spicy pork tacos with green sauce and pineapple. It will not disappoint at all. Once you walk in the store there is a lady making fresh corn tortillas right in front. The menu is large for a taqueria so I say go with new and favorites at this place. I got 3 pork and 2 Asada tacos. The pork was by far better than the asada. I wouldn't get the steak again but it was tasty. This is my new quick bite spot, however the line for the pork tacos takes a long time. Be prepared to wait at least 30mins.

TzA54HgS1cSEf4DHE9bkhg.text: This was our FIRST stop in Vegas so that's telling you something! There's always a long line to get in and once you're in the restaurant, you need to get into another line to order! Haha but it's worth the wait! We've had our order delivered to our hotel room before but it's not the same. It took 45 minutes to get our order because our delivery guy got lost.   You can't go wrong on any of their tacos but we always end up ordering their fries!! Their lengua fries and horchata are my go-to orders but my fiance will order their tacos and vampiros every so often. It's a must when we're in Vegas!!

2afaGBiasCXJAuLk67c7SQ.text: It's Tacos El Gordo.  It's reputation precedes itself. There's not to much to say except if you want tacos at almost anytime of the day, come here. Wide range of meats and other parts of the body (lol), salsa on deck, peppers on deck, and handmade tortillas right in front of you.   Horchata, Tamarindo, and other drinks available. Go. You won't be disappointed. Don't @ me

xyV2zr6chA1OYeCYgzsIqg.text: I've seen my friends post pictures of their meals from Tacos El Gordo and heard nothing but good things. My gf and I saw their billboard on the 15 and agreed to go give them a try.  Before heading to a friend's house, we stopped by to pick up some grub.  First of all: Why is the ordering system so complicated for no reason? You can only order certain items through certain people. One person takes your order for certain meats, the other person takes the order for other items.  Anyway, after discovering how ordering works, we ordered several tacos and quesadillas.  The cool thing is that the adobada gets carved right in front of you. The tacos get assembled on the spot too.  I'm not sure if I've been eating different quesadillas my whole life, but the quesadillas here are... different. I'm not putting it against them or anything, but these were definitely not the quesadillas I'm familiar with. The taquerias at home are the quesadillas I've eaten my whole life. Meat, cheese, and sometimes sour cream.  Of course the guy we ordered from wasn't the grilled peppers person, so we had to go into a different lane to get said peppers. The woman gave us a glare and tossed in a measly 2 peppers for a large meal. I didn't realize requesting peppers was such an ordeal.  The tacos were good, but honestly with how unnecessarily complicated everything is, I think I'll go elsewhere if I'm in the mood for tacos.

cALpKSZ4DjbcwUi108WsVQ.text: Lines are unbelievable specially if you have to stand there under the hot sun. A little pricy for a taco but you could find worse. Tacos are pretty tasty. Make sure to ask for grilled onions and pineapple as sides. Make sure to tip the bucket.

JYH4Weawx3wYzwmmpsdz2g.text: The asada tacos were a little dry, I wish there was a self serve salsa bar with some good red sauce. My chorizo tacos were a little burnt, but it didn't bother me too much. The al pastor tacos were definitely the best!   If you like hot  or spicy tacos this place is not for you.

XXG4TOqr4DjxtrF8Sbt-9A.text: So worth the wait!  Waited in line about 5 min it was a tad longer once you got inside!  You are put in a line according to what type of taco you want. So yummy. The meet was tender and full of flavor   The security guard that was directing people was kind and courteous. She did a great job.   The cooks! All I can say is WOW!  He knife skills are amazing!

gwcPFeuFAweTtGi09ELJjQ.text: Need a taco fix while walking on the Strip? Definitely make it down to Tacos El Gordo. As the last ones standing from our work trip, my coworker suggested this place since he goes every trip.  Quick background: This place is based on a place in San Diego (where my coworker originally is from) which was based from a place in Tijuana. Don't get it twisted.  If you go and the lines look RIDICULOUS, don't worry. It actually goes by rather quickly, but I can't guarantee that you'll get a table. The best tacos I got were the Al Pastor (get the pineapples as a side!!) and the Carne Asada.... because well, I'm basic. I did try the beef tongue and the tripa, but if we're talking best- definitely go for the classics.

aqgXwCDodjMkfc6Tt1jkWg.text: This spot is a gem. Tacos were amazing. I normally don't eat red meat but I make exceptions for certain experiences and this was one.  The place is next to Encore/Wynn and a contrast to their expensive foods. It's a real Mexican simple local place. You walk in and order at the food counter. Then you take your plate to the register. It is busy and goes fast, I had a hard time figuring out how the menu works so I just ordered something I saw on yelp. I looked around and saw all kind of things, if only I knew what/how. I ordered the taco el pastor with pineapple and mula el pastor, both with the carne asado. It looks like shoarma but it tastes nothing like it. It was good but the meat I wouldn't order again. Unfortunately there's not really other options here, not that I know of at least (didn't see chicken). The food was really good, the taco and mula were top noch. Other taco places can learn something from here!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco el pastor with grilled pineapple

0efnpBFszr4JwQVxuAtFEw.text: If you fail to plan, plan to fail.  Treat this like a Black Friday event and you'll be fine. Reinforcements are a necessity...especially if you want to try a variety of things.  There are different lines for different food items.  Lines were about a 20 minute wait at 11pm on a Sunday night.  Make sure you write everyone's order down especially if they want items left out of the taco.  It's like going to a store for milk, and forgetting what you came there for.    The closer you get to the front, the more entertaining it is.  They prep the tacos and the tortillas right in front of you.  It was a mini Vegas show! The guys move quickly so you shouldn't complain about how long it takes to get your food.    We were a party of nine foodies.  We all agreed that the food was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the free shows in Vegas!

CT4_EJNF5xTspAvsHdZgZg.text: Oh..My...Delicious.  I absolutely love the food here. The set up is different. They have each counter labeled with the different meat options you just walk up to the counter that has the meat of your choice and order. Then once you get your food there's  is a counter off to the right to pay by the drink fountains.   I got 3 tacos one chicken one steak and one pork. All amazing and loaded with meat. I also ordered the Asada fries.. OH EM GEE. AMAZING. They're packed with steak and this delicious special sauce. Also there's cheese avocado and a spicy sauce on them. The fries were worth coming here alone.   I recommend 10/10 to anyone in the area!!!

NnvPvQsnUvH78gZ_4n7q7A.text: The tacos are so good here!  I've been here 3 times during my Las Vegas trips and I will always put it down on things to do while in Vegas. The prices is really good. The tacos are a good size and they stack it with meat. I've had the al pastor which is AMZING. the lengua is also good. The sauce and tortillas are a plus as well. Overall a perfect taco. The have a salsa bar that is filled with goodness!  Just prepare yourself for a long line but so worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0uDGLiZWiKKaQeHO-VOONg.text: I can finally say I've tried all the tacos El Gordo locations in the United States lol. And I can say this location is nothing like the ones in San Diego. I tried the adobada fries and adobada tacos. The fries do come in 2 sizes, half and full order.  It was good but I can tell it tasted a little different. But it did satisfy my cravings.    The concept is the same. You wait in line to order your food and then pay at the register. The line went out the door and wrapped outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small adobada fries

B2wEXh0mNV_OkkXBYkLWaQ.text: Literally walked 3 miles each way for Tacos El Gordo. I've only been to the Chula Visa location & was SO stoked to find out that Tacos El Gordo is now in Vegas. If TEG were around during my Vegas heyday, I would have gone after EVERY XS/Encore night.  We ordered Adobada, lengua & carne asada tacos as well as a half order of campechana fries (topped with adobada, carne asada, guac and cheese).   The adobada is the way to go here! It's like an al pastor spit where the cook freshly slices it when you order & the corn tortillas are toasted in the adobada fat.   The carne asada and lengua are good but not as good as the adobada.   For 8 tacos, a half order of fries (which is already a huge portion btw), and a fountain drink, it was ~$30. I feel like this is just a smidge pricier than the Chula Vista location, but still worth it!   77/365

gbHdyJNeIxNi13Ds2zqP_Q.text: A staple on the Vegas strip, always find myself here no matter what when In Vegas. Tacos are some of the best I've ever had and the food is given to you quickly. Friendly staff. The ONLY reason I didn't give this review 5 stars is because of the limited seating compared to the amount of customers they have. I had to eat my tacos standing up so my family would have a place to sit. Other than that I would recommend this place to everyone

XNTYJms4AtL_g0nYR7xO_w.text: PURE insanity. Adobada is a must! Mulas are wild. If you're in the wrong line for adobada, throw them a $5 and they'll go get it for you in any line. WORTH THE CRAZY LINE

HJhueTuI8egQcHR7ad4Crw.text: The best street tacos I've ever had! Loved this place and will definitely come back the next time I am visiting Las Vegas! The tacos were so good because everything was fresh. Service was great as well. I had three Carne Asada tacos and was tempted to get back in line and order more when I was done! Great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tastes as good as it looks

OIWt7EtlObUhWtGj1JEyng.text: Bottom line: Solid 4 stars. Plan ample time to stand in the various (up to 4 lines) to get your street tacos.  After reading the reviews, we hopped in an Uber and had to try it. We arrived early and waited for the doors to open. When they did, my partner and I split up into 2 additional lines. Specific meat or tacos were specific lines only. It took us 30 mins to get our tacos from 3 lines. Once we did, we both found the food to be good and well seasoned.   I had adobada, carne asada, lengua, and tripas. All were good but would rate the carne asada the Best flavored, followed by the adobada, then the other two. Very filling and delicious.

Un7PhYQINrT37YR8dggQXQ.text: Authentic, fresh food prepared to order.  Note:  there are different lines depending on what you are ordering.  Be prepared to order when you arrive to the counter.  We had the steak tacos with " everything "  (steak, onion,  cilantro, red salsa and thin guacamole sauce.    After ordering, you wait at counter watching your food being prepared, then have to walk over to another counter to pay and add drinks if you want.   Highly recommended asking for a side of verde salsa during your checkout.

DWY26j0gQXsMDVqhPfFr0Q.text: This place was recommended by a friend. I tried the asada tacos the first time and they were good. The next time I came I tried the Al Pastor and they were amazing!!! Don't be discouraged by the long lines, this place is worth it! The Al Pastor is soooo worth it, add extra sauce! This is always my first stop when I arrive in Vegas and when I leave.

chSSB80NnFO6sjkfsIRxUw.text: Get one each of everything line up 3 times - one for pork, one for beef and the last line at the far end serves offal etc.   One of the best authentic Mexican places I've been to. Top notch.   Had to come back the second time in 3 days. So bloody good!

hHPi5X05FzU7SujulpjtPg.text: Omg !! You guys I came to the famous TACOS EL GORDO in Las Vegas !!! Honestly my Lyft driver was like there ok and I was ready to be disappointed but can I say IT WAS SO GOOD, it definitely will be a must when every I come back to Vegas. Yes the Al Pastor was more I expected but I am a tripa type of girl and that was so amazing they left my mouth wanting more.. so if ever you are in town come into get these mouth watering tacos !! Ok I'm going to go get some more

7icm1YrLnI9YybEzUcKqxQ.text: If you're in Vegas, you must stop here!!!   Conveniently located right next to Encore (and walking distance from Trump and many other hotels), Tacos El Gordo is a great place for a (sometimes) quick and delicious dinner. Their layout is basically identical to the original San Diego one as there are multiple lines for different meats. Once you reach the front of the line, tell the cook VERY clearly what meat and how many tacos you want. I say this with an added emphasis because my 8 lengua and 1 tripa somehow turned into 8 lengua and 8 tripa... After you're done ordering and receive your food, make your way to the cash register near the door and pay for your heaping tray of deliciousness. From there on out, it's your choice to bring your tacos home to-go or find a table to eat at.   Food here is really good and hit the spot for me and my family when we visited. The quality is the exact same as the SD one and I was very satisfied with the customer service received. Personal favorites are lengua and al pastor! This place did not disappoint so next time you're famished and starving after a long trek down The Strip, make a stop at Tacos El Gordo for a satisfying and hearty meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lengua, adobado, tripa

9rgwtbpRw0EYKQVtAghuow.text: We came to get tacos and the mola. They apparently ran out of cheese. Wtf? I'm sorry but a Mexican restaurant shouldn't run out of cheese that's like in n out running out of buns. NOT OK!!!! Super rude

iUkI-LATAc-8FKmiYz8Fig.text: Yelped this place before coming here and it seems like an authentic Mexican taco shop. Came here during the summer, it was hot and thankfully the line was not long, waited about 30-45 min outside then went in and had to wait for another 20-30min (at least in the asada line). They have their lines divided, starting from left to right: adobado/pastor meat, asada was the next line (they longest waiting line), then all other meat: tripa, tongue. After getting your food, you have to walk to the cashier table near the exit to pay for your food and then sit down. This place is very busy and gets really pack so seats are minimal for big groups. My group and I was lucky to find enough seats for 10ppl. Service was ok, food was flavorful and tasty. Also they had fountain drinks available and I thought their horchata was freshly made thinking that this is from Tijuana Mexico, but it was not so this was the only disappointment. In addition, their quesadilla is NOT like the American quesadilla so don't expect it that way- its more like a large taco. Overall, this was a great experience and good was great with lots of meat! I would come here again.   Tip: have someone in your party to find seat while the others order your food

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Closer look at Taco
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside view towards the strip

5C4GF85d3U-ZRNG7_LhT4w.text: Ive been to Vegas twice and both visits Ive went to Tacos El Gordo. The first time was as mind blowing as the next. I enjoyed every single part of the meal. Upon arrival you'll probably get hit by several lines and be confused af, ask one of the staff to explain each of the lines to you so you can line up according, sometimes they can get other things from other lines for you if it isn't too busy. When youre done picking and choosing all the tacos, (seriously get ALL OF THEM!) as well as a order of fries (half portion is enough for 2) get in the cashier line and pay the lady! it might be hard to find a seat sometimes especially if you're visiting on a busy weekend.   The service is very fast-food but everyone is very friendly and will engage in conversation if you want. its as authentic as it gets.   The price is cheap but it surely does not affect the quality of the food. I had tacos in New York at the Chelsea Market  and it was 3.99 EACH taco, for less than half of that Tacos EL Gordo has you beat ;)  The location was very easy to find there is also parking for those who chose to drive. Its also walking distance from the Wynn-Encore hotel!   This has became a Vegas-Must for me personally every time I come, my visits were 3 years apart but the quality hasnt seemed to have changed whatsoever,

WuIc6uSbDHGeY5jgdEGDcg.text: Hands down the best tacos in Vegas. The Al Pastor tacos are an experience in and of themselves. I wish they were closer and I wish they served beer but I am still happily make the trek across town to get those amazing tacos.

gUjZHdgTblcs0uK8dwtL8g.text: Authentic Mexican tacos!!!  I've been from Washington DC to Los Angeles, CA and several points in between, and everywhere I good I'm looking to try the local taco place.  None of them compare to El Gordo.  This is the best taco place outside of Mexico.

grf3av1m2NFc_8hE8alYNg.text: It's delicious. YES! I love it... but.... It is an overpriced taco which is normal for every restaurant on the strip but this is a bit too much. If you are a taco lover it will be hard to get full unless you are willing to spend $30. They are very small compared to a regular taco from any taco truck. Although there is no risks here, the meat is great quality and the taste is the closest you will get to trying a taco in close resemblance to ones in Mexico. Another thing is this place is always busy, this location is always busy. There is always a line so be prepared and come in 1 or 2 hours before the time you usually get hungry. It's a line to order and it's another line to pay. Overall I give it 4 stars based on the price but taste wise it's the best taco I've tried so far in Vegas without suffering repercussion the next morning.

hruyfJznWKT3BOH4snYAdw.text: The food is cheqp but the time you eat its cold. Idk what happend bit today there system sucked. Not good. Food its good.  But you better be prepared to eat cold tacos.. Lol

VLNJsmOTA3hu3bEQfqOggg.text: Best tacos north of Mexico! Very authentic! Very tasty! Papas carne asada! The best quesadillas in Las Vegas!

kJI5K4lMfxIvArG8ngyJjQ.text: The best tacos in the world... Love this place.. Quick nice and clean food.. Never got any problems after eating her Mexican food.. No need to say to much just go and try..

jPZieREg9rWUkh_ZPs8Hvw.text: Not sure if it's better than the one in Chula Vista BUT they have Adobada fries and that's a winner to meeeee!

7F6w2dq-GrLxBu-IuyH8dg.text: If you have ever been to a tacos el gordo, you can understand how delicious their tacos are. I can say I have been to every single one of their locations and I love each and every one of them. They are consistent in taste and price and I can't get enough. A must-go!

sBDEGhDiQ5ehoxQF5yhqyQ.text: Over priced for mediocre tacos plus its always to packed standings in different lines is dumb cause if you want 2 different tacos by the time you sit to eat your food is cold.

3PQEJdZjys3SF8npC7w79w.text: This place is off the chain.... the best tacos you can ask for.... there is no bad choice for me except the seso brain tacos.... very delicious and yummy.... must try place in Vegas and a short cab ride from everywhere on the strip.... fast quick and easy

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q2nOqD8cGoi6PoOVIci9Rg.text: Best tacos in town!!! First time here was a bit confusing, their line system is not what I'm used to, they have different lines for different types of tacos. My favorite was the el pastor!!! It's like nothing I've ever had before, their sauce goes perfect with the meat. Now every time I'm in Vegas, I know I'll be stopping here for sure.

ZinNtg7FWApm6W73MOKwGQ.text: Tacos El Gordo is a classic for those who are up at random hours at Vegas. There are multiple people who can take orders, but there is still usually a line going out the door. After ordering the dishes and receiving your food, you must go to a different line at the cash register to pay for everything. I think that concept is quite strange, and I would like to see that changed if possible. I love that we get our food very soon after we order it, but it is such a tease to have to stand in another line after receiving our food.  As for the food, it is the perfect place to go to if you are craving Mexican food. The meat for the tacos were very tender and soft. The carne asada fries did not have as many toppings such as salsa, beans, etc. as I normally get. But, the portion was still large and I really enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kgbybrAOuD-Yzc508nh-Ag.text: Tacos El Gordo was exactly what I needed on the last day of my trip. I was craving some affordable authentic Mexican food, and thought I'd have the place pretty much to myself on a Sunday morning around 11am. Not so much.  They were very busy and I found out after a while that there were also separate lines for different meat. Oops. I ordered the spicy pork tacos, lingua, and asada tacos. I loved that they had fresh guacamole on top and also verde salsa. The tacos were fresh and good, but I felt that they were missing something. Maybe the roja salsa? Also, I love it with the creamy jalapeno sauce, and they didn't have that either. So I wasn't quite getting the spice level or sauce that I wanted, but they still hit the spot when I needed it.  Also, you are supposed to order, get your food, pay, then eat. It's sorta a weird system and I wasn't aware of that when I stopped in and had to tell them what I ordered at the end.

G6-pxTCjZ_Y6M5Yi2vXFuQ.text: I'm from Southern California so I know good tacos! This was a decent taco lol. Waited about 45 min in line which I really don't care for but I wish it was an excellent taco for that wait time.   Also, myself and my date both felt sick for a full day after

NHk_Bp6RCwYq7CbR1qDf3Q.text: My cousin has heard nothing but good things about Tacos El Gordo so she decided to take her kids and I here for dinner. Let me tell you, if I could, I would take a turbulent flight back to Las Vegas for some chorizo tacos and some carne asada fries right this second.  When approaching the plaza El Gordo is in, you can definitely tell its not the upscale part of Vegas.  Trust me, I definitely felt sketchy walking up to this place, I was thinking "what's my cousin thinking? We're in Vegas, let's go eat at a buffet or something", but my cousin stood her ground! We ended up waiting in what seemed to be SUCH a long line, but it moved pretty quickly. It can be expected to wait around 30-45 mins. We ordered and what impressed me most is everything is made to order, even the tortillas! So fresh, so good. Getting to watch your food being made, even better, smells and all.  I would say that the experience that you would receive here is no different than a fast food restaurant. Order food, pick up and pay. Tacos El Gordo is not a really waitressed place although there is tons of seating. Even when there was so much seating it was super packed so we decided to take it to the car to enjoy. I can tell you right now, that it's the most authentic Mexican food I've EVER had and it's the BEST Mexican food that I've ever tasted.  I guess the saying is right, "you should never  judge a book by its cover".

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the line inside, there is a line outside. It was worth the wait though!
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada, chorizo and grilled veggies in the making.
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Freshly cooked tortillas.

9t_YPd4ySTuGBBTmDpGZ6Q.text: When you show up at a place slightly off the strip at 11:15 for lunch, and the line is easily 30 minutes, wrapped around the store, and out the door, you know you are on to something. The masses cannot be wrong, and they aren't. If I lived here, I'd be getting tacos here once a week.   The assembly line moves fairly quickly and each taco is made, sliced, and chopped to order. I went with the spicy pork and tripe tacos. These little guys are surprisingly filling; don't let their size deceive you. The pork tacos were tender and juicy, with just stumble hints of sweetness and spice. Excellent. The tripe tacos are a little chewy, a little crispy, and a little funky. If you like funkiness and organ meat, this is for you. The fat in the meat almost gets caramelized to the point of it sticking in your teeth. Its some quality offal.   If you are in town, come slightly off of the strip and get yourself a few tacos, and thank me after.

VCrt4yKu9A6inBQX0vB-8w.text: Best tacos ive ever had!!!!! Superr friendly people ...loveee this place!!!They need some locations in southern cali tho...Id be there every weekend!!!!

CYD4-5mS0Epl4TDFkA1T2A.text: If U ever come to vegas, 100% you should make at least fifteen visits to Tacos El Gordo. This place is AMAZING (especially after a lit night of clubbing and drunken shenanigans).  Their taco ingredient variety is off the CHAIN, ranging from beef guts, pork stomach, and even pork tongue if you're feeling especially daring. If you're looking for a classic choice that you can't go wrong with, cop thier adobada tacos which feature the most amazing spiced pork that will be sure to elevate lit levels to a maximum.  AAHHHHHH DOOOOO BAAAA DAAAA !!!  Next time I'm in Vegas I'm fersure going to run into Tacos El Gordo and yell out  "AAHHHHHH DOOOOO BAAAA DAAAA !!! "  so they know exactly what I want to eat.  AAHHHHHH DOOOOO BAAAA DAAAA !!!

7ENYUUNpV8BWqnFtGJ78Tw.text: We decided to try this place out as we LOVE tacos and sometimes it's hard to find a good taco place that serves Tripa & Lengua tacos. This place did not dissapoint! It was no wonder as to why the lines were so long. We went back two different times we tried; Lengua, Tripas, Sesos, & asada tacos, we also tried the Lengua fries. They were seriously the best I can think of that I have had.   I would definitely recommend this place if you LOVE tacos. Also if it's your first time there the lines have signs so you could know what station serves what kind of meat.

3o9UQdaK7hn7dYjU-H36cg.text: The best  tacos , I have ever tried  Definitely was worth the wait and line .... Hand made tortillas the salsas are delicious the lengua tacos are delicious as well  Would definitely recommend it

mcChO5ZgBl57qQhJNUEJ0g.text: Best tacos in Las Vegas! I ordered 4 of the Adobada tacos with everything on them. So good that you don't even need hot sauce. The line was a bit long, but expected since this place is super popular. I would come back again, and again, and again.

7IhV6swZvTy0gsNPcujWuQ.text: Yummy street tacos with an attitude. I sampled as many as my gluttonous tummy could hold. My favorite is the adobada (pork with a statement) but the carne asada was good too (good charred carbon flavor). Reasonable prices too ($2.25 for most tacos). And yes these are (only) slightly larger than the tacos you'd buy south of the border. Highly recommended. Oh and the suadero (brisket) tacos were good too but a bit underwhelming.  Go!

2_rL4BUcFPaOdXqTJUg5uA.text: This place is amazing after a long night of drinking!! Don't be afraid of how hectic it looks inside and how long the line is. The line move pretty quick. We got the Asada and Spicy Pork. They have different lines for each tacos. The two middle one is Asada and Spicy Pork. I like the Spicy Pork more than the Asada. Sucks I forgot to ask for the pineapple. But the sauce and the tortilla was so good!! We got totally of 9 tacos and one drink for 28. I will come back to this place for sure next time I'm in Vegas.

Q63Gb1SGzykncKV_ETvrfQ.text: Great tacos on Vegas Strip with affordable price that  is open pretty late for your tacos fix

FeH7xGsZd8QYbSFuRnpqYw.text: 4.5 stars for the yummy food and cheap price but 2 stars for their terrible line system. Well worth the 45 min wait, but I couldn't believe the terrible inefficient multiple lines depending on what meat you wanted ! And then a separate line to pay! My husband and I split to 2 lines but he got his food much faster than the line I was in so he just ordered a whole bunch and I left my line.  Got the flan for dessert was good. I'll be back the next time in town!

U4sWHNwd-xP8S9qcrQuDMg.text: I don't recommended this place only if you want to spend about 2hrs in line  plus 35min just to get 2 taco de asada and a Mula , food had no flavor only nice thing to say is the guacamole was ok

pCf8D9rFu9U3tsYc3-bIIw.text: My family and I wanted to try this place so bad since lots of people talk so many good things about it. So excited we waited in line for a little more than an hour just for the worst experience ever when it comes to ordering your food and getting to enjoy it.  This place is so unorganized so be ready or you may end up with cold food (unless you like cold food) just because you can't pay for it till you order everything so if you what to try different meats you'll end up making line for every meat and of cursed a lot of people want asada so it takes longer(big line for two guys not help). And for what I notice lots of people were complaining about their food ending up getting cold.

Hmcka_WIjzhDVbprPbd92A.text: Straight trash. Very rude people, the meat taste very oily. We tried to get a get a large drink and the lady said I already charged you for two and I can't take it off before we even paid. Then the bathroom was so dirty there was a homeless man in there washing up at sink. DONT COME HERE!!!

CQ5SwHfbT7xv2InoJ0sctw.text: If you are a fan of tacos this is the place. I love there carnitas, it is well cooked. The service is fast and friendly. The prices are great as well

3KymUmu8gwe4wCO3t_5VJw.text: We waited exactly one hour in line and it felt like I was at the DMV. The line coils around and around so you're waiting on foot and really close to other people. This was on a Sunday morning so we thought it would be less crowded. But there was nowhere to sit either. The food was good especially the loaded fries but I don't eat much meat so I can't comment on that. It was just really loud and crowded and took forever so I'd suggest going when you're not starving.

0sbv6y3lMr5-vr7WQW15XQ.text: I would say this place would of been great if their tortillas weren't so rock hard, dry with razor sharp edges and if they offered hot sauces or fresh salsas. I'm way too much of a sauce snob and I admit it. I was very disappointed that there was no salsa bar or sauce for that matter. The tacos could of used a nice dollop of moist and flavorful salsa.  Granted the carne asada (beef) and the adobada (pork) were marinated well and very tender, I needed a spicy kick in my life! Even the grilled jalapeno pepper they offered us wasn't spicy.   I favored the adobada over the carne asada, it seemed more tender. Also, the taco de cabeza (head) was really oily, we took a bite and couldn't eat the rest.  The vampiro, had a sopes masa cake bottom and a crispy fried tortilla tostada-like top. It was filled with carne asada (or any meat you choose), a dense piece of rubber-like cheese, and topped with lots of their guacamole sauce and cilantro and onions. It was tasty, hard to eat, and extremely filling!   Their avocado sauce that they put on everything tasted good, but it was very thick and filling. It's not made of 100% avocados and they may of added some type of filler in it.   Make sure to ask for a complimentary plate of grilled green onion and peppers, they don't offer it unless you ask for it.  6 small tacos, 2 vampiros, and a soda totals $23.02

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobada action
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Receipt for 2
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I wish they offered spicy salsa or a salsa bar for that matter. it needed it!

cNIXjJQ-i8Kv9J_0YyDYWg.text: Best. Tacos. Ever. Fresh tortillas. The only negative is the long wait, but it is well worth it! Never thought I'd find tacos this good in the U.S.

uWYsMHTA5LiNPhiQYxoH5A.text: One of the best Taco places in Vegas. No matter what time you go there is always a line. However even though the wait may be long, it is totally worth it. My sister took me here since we were craving tacos on our last night in Vegas and I wished I knew of this place sooner. Their meats are perfectly seasoned and cooked. Honestly one of the best authentic tacos I've had in a long time. I plan to come back here if I'm ever in town again!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PF67NSDL19Bw0o0hydnzCw.text: Was greeted by a very nice young lady . Very clean restaurant. All the Condiments were fully stocked and fresh. Tacos were the bomb beans salsas outstanding.

dyMg5L8Jr-pIyDTdAf6vHg.text: as the Nature boy once said......"WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!"  this place is so freaking delicious. You can't lose with any choice of tacos.   the set up is a little weird but hey it's vegas. Each different taco has a different line (which can be long as hell...but worth it)   Perfect spot to go after a hard night out ....or morning after.  A definite stop each vegas trip!  if you go with a group of friend, split a box of carne asada fries!!!!

BjkuZa53F7dIyJ5kJ4NHLA.text: Fabulous, fast, authentic delicious street food. Try the mulas if you haven't had it before. Incredible taste and value. Top notch!

axGaTUuhmqCcvVOlHL17OQ.text: If you want indulge in your GORDO side, then look no further. These tacos are legit.  The set up at first was intimidating. Whose is line, whose not, what is this line even anyway? That sort of thing. Luckily, I had a guide. He lead me into the promise land of PASTOR Y ADOBADA line.  Once your in line, the hard part is over. What to order? Just get tacos with everything on it. What's the everything they put on it? There was cilantro and a bunch of other stuff and some sauce in there. Who knows what it all was but it was fresh flavor explosion. It's hard not to get double digit tacos in line. The meat is on point, juicy and flavorful. The tortillas were little warm circles of deliciousness. I also got a quesadilla where they toast one tortilla and put some Oaxaca cheese in there. Weirdest quesadilla I'd ever seen but it was damn good though.   The challenge is to get a seat really. Luckily, they do also have "to go" option where they wrap up your plate of tacos with aluminium foil, like you just left a party with some food to take home to the kids. Being well lit and remarkably clean despite the throngs of people in there was amazing.

wn4swSGenQarDPGMqLD_pA.text: Great taco's! Our favorite were the pork ones. Great stop whenever in Vegas and post night out.

DaZ7k5vNWvUFOkQqcfn32Q.text: A lil overhyped if you ask me I would give 3.5 just cause of the wait but ill round up. The food is good but not worth the insane wait. However, it IS a great addition to cheaper alternative food options in vegas besides china town. Both the adobada and carne asada are good. The adobada line is much shorter and had died down even while we were waiting for carne asada. We coulda stood in the adobada line 3 times in the time it took to even get a carne asada taco. My suggestion if you dont have time you can totally skip the carne asada and just get adobada.  I got a carne asada Mula, which is like a quesadilla cept its not sealed in? You can also think of it as a taco sandwich if one taco is an open-faced sandwich with one slice of bread then the mula is like having two slices of bread and more cheese in between.   Right now they have two lines for carne asada and two lines for adobada. Due to the popularity of carne asada, they should totally just have 3 lines for that and 1 line for adobada.

rQHH6B9VmYzBU0i5L1QU2g.text: **BEST HANGOVER TACOS IN VEGAS**  Trust me, we needed this. Like, ALL of it.  ABOUT ====== Family owned and operated company, opening their first business in 1972. In 1998, Tacos El Gordo opened its first location in San Diego, California, and in 2010 opened its first location in Las Vegas.  PARKING ======== Strip mall.  AMBIANCE ========= Crowded, noisy, and somewhat small. Grab a table inside or outside.  NOTES:  #1 - There are different lines to order for different things. Be sure to designate and assign your party members to get in a specific line to order specific items.   #2 - You order FIRST in line and then you go to ANOTHER line (the cashier) to pay. Not very convenient, especially during busy hours.  FOOD ===== CARNE ASADA FRIES - $10 I like perfect fries with meat and toppings. So, these were OK. The fries could have been a bit more crispy. I like the version in San Diego better. RATING: 3/5  ADOBADA TACOS - $2 My favorite.  Pork marinated in a "red" chilli sauce with vinegar and oregano was perfect. RATING: 5/5  PASTOR TACOS - $2 Pork is marinated in a combination of dried chiles, spices and pineapple. Ask for pieces of the pineapple off the spit. RATING: 5/5  CEBOLLINES (GRILLED GREEN ONIONS) - PRICE N/A Nothing special, not much flavor. A bit oily. RATING: 3/5  BEVERAGES ========== HORCHATA Not the best I've had. Too mild. I want more cinnamon. RATING: 3/5  SERVICE ======= They are efficient, but not exactly smiley friendly.  RECOMMEND for hangovers, groups, and cheap eats.

rI1lY6K5ETuxFNJcTufM1g.text: Amazing place! My aunt and uncle who recently moved to vegas really wanted to try this place to see what the rave is all about & it definitely lives up to the hype!  We walked in kinda confused cuz there were just a bunch of lines but this nice customer gave us a rundown on how it worked- line up in front of the sign that has the meat/item you want and then pay at the cashier. We got carne asada tacos and fries, but I thought they were just alright. I tried adobada mulas for the very first time and was mind blown how good it was. I had to get back in line and order more! Definitely check this place out for some mouthgasmic tacos

cmqlDswNiieJWdo0s-3aEQ.text: I LOVE this place.  When I get to the club, I'm thinking about what time I'm leaving for Taco's El Gordo to beat the rush.  Oh Chainsmokers on at 1:30? I'm out of there by 2:30 and making the 5 minute walk (From Wynn/Encore) for some TACOS!  The al pastor tacos and abodabo fries are all I ever get here.  Its deliciously flavored and they make it right in front of you!  They slice and dice and throw everything together right there for you to see!  The tacos come on double corn torilla with their signature green sauce.  The abodabo fries has abodabo on top of skinny fries and lathered with sour cream, guacamole and the green sauce.  NOM NOM NOMZ.  Skinny fries should be the only fries allowed!    So you order at one of the stations that are labelled with the kind of meat they serve and after you get your food, you head to back to the front to pay for everything.  There are a lot of tables but there are also usually a lot of people but it moves pretty quickly.  They have a nice salsa bar with all kinds of condiments to make your meal all that more enjoyable.  There are two abodabo  lines so if you're in a really long line, look around as the other one is typically a lot shorter.

J2aEKv7b1W1AbQuDmdt5zg.text: Authentic and delicious, just make sure you get in the correct line for what you want to order

m6Eye5lAMXkK0ZakMXNJYQ.text: great food! lines are always long. The service is ok, but sometimes the people who works there are rude.

uGjJSc-HqF3ofTFdwBUmGA.text: Awesome. Just simply awesome. The food is prepared in front of you and the environment was pretty amaZing. Can't wait to go back

hFs8D4aQ0JgY7d3DCHXs3w.text: Came out to TEG on Sunday before 4th of July. Man was this place BUSYYYY the evening I went. I was in Vegas solo this time around, so I took a buddy out to taste this place, as he as a local had never been. I ordered 11 Adobada tacos and that alone LOL. 6 for me, 5 for my buddy. The line took forever and a half to get to the front, but was well worth it. TIP: If you speak Spanish, the folks that make your tacos at the front of the line, can be nicely asked if they don't mind getting you some tacos from another line, so you don't have to make line for a different meat. Had to get some to-go tacos for another friend who wasn't able to meet up with us to dine, and they wanted tacos de lengua, but that was a different line. So I kindly asked the gentleman at the Adobada line if he could get me a few lengua tacos. He said they can, but has to be aa couple max, so I asked for 4 lengua tacos and he obliged nicely. Tipped him for it on the jar in front, and on our way we went.  The thing I love about this place is that regardless of when you come, the quality of the food, the texture, and the sauces... it all remains constant. That is why I believe so many people flock to TEG on their Vegas trips. Needless to say, I shall be back next month when I'm in town for the Mayweather/McGregor fight!!

3Wz5DyB3jaPYq0Y7Oj9gTg.text: Oh my, do not buy into this hype! I'm not sure if Vegas just has the worlds most extremely sad Hispanic food selection to earn this high marks but this place is absolute chaos. You stand in line for about 30 minutes before you get inside and then the line is forcing you to choose between which item you want. If you want an Asada taco and a tongue tacos you will have to stand through multiple lines! God for bid you're somebody like me who wants chicken, they do not even offer it. You are allowed red meat, the other white meat/pork or organs....no chicken. I waited in line for 45 minutes to get a tostada....which they were out of, then I had to get in a second line to get a taco al pastor. It is a complete nightmare. You stand in all the lines getting your food, the drinks are on the different side of the store and then all the lines merge into this absolute terror as you have to pay for your food next to the exit, so........after all the lines, you're now combating with people trying to leave while paying for your food before you can eat. It would be so easy to fix this problem, have three guys working on meat prep while 2 or 3 people are taking orders and put the register somewhere near where you're taking orders! The food flavors here are absolutely flat best. They added red and green salsa to every item I ordered without Asking permission but it was perfectly fine since the salsas have absolutely no heat, there was no hint of garlic or onion or any recognizable flavor, it just added color to each item. While I was standing in line in over 100 heat for more than 30 minutes at one point every person stop taking orders because they are required to cook their own meat for their station, so the entire line, every line, comes to a complete stand still while they prepare their own meat before they will start taking our own orders again. SKIP IT!

o6JeBN-cyV5LStOYGACaRg.text: Hands down to their Adobada Tacos and Adobada Fries. Every time we go the line is always long and the place is always packed. Definitely a must try if you are in SD.

jiAS-a366jT0lzr9FMlGUQ.text: Possibly the best tacos I have ever had in my life. Be warned it gets VERY busy but the lines move fast. 100% returning here each time I'm in vegas

5gsUCGIU9xIZ3ALXma4Izg.text: The best tacos this side of the Mexican border in my opinion I love the lengue aka tongue Eating at  El Gordo is like being on the street in Mexico delicious and fresh With friendly customer service I also enjoyed the mula

zOQDgQMeAKqsqs0PZbYW5g.text: I will keep it short and sweet. This place is worth a visit every time you're in this town.   Hands down best carne asada I've ever had and there signature al pastor is also the best I've ever had.   If I were a rich man and I wanted tacos or really good Mexican I'd fly my jet here just to get tacos!!   Lit AF!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KY4NrymluJmzMVC3IRufcQ.text: While now living in the Bay Area, I grew up in San Diego where I got spoiled with good Mexican food.  In a way, I took it for granted.  The Bay Area has some of the best food spots around, but in terms of Mexican food, I'm sorry, it just doesn't cut it.  Every time I go back to San Diego, I always make 1 or 2 (or 3) stops at Tacos El Gordo.  While I don't go to Vegas too often, it's good to know that I can do the same there, as well.  When it comes to Tacos El Gordo, the 1 thing you have to get is the Adobada taco.  It's spicy pork (although, not very spicy at all) it comes with a green sauce that complements it perfectly.  When you see the pork being shaved off the spit rod, your mouth will start to water.  Also good is the SD-staple, carne asada.  The meat is perfectly seasoned and cooked and is served with the freshest guacamole.  Not the watered down stuff you will find at the taquerias here in Northern California.  If I go with a group of friends, we will almost always share an order of the Campechana fries.  It is similar to carne asada fries you will find throughout San Diego, but is made with Adobada meat, as well, and is served with that same green sauce that is served on the tacos.  If you like some of the other cuts of meat that usually go with tacos, then they probably have those here, too.  I'm talking about Lengua (Tongue), Buche (Pork Stomach), Cabeza (Beef head), or Tripa (Beef Guts).  They also have different vehicles for all their meats, like Mulas, Tostadas, Suadero, or Sopes.  They also have quesadillas, in which you can add meat, if you want.  They are pretty small though, so if you're hungry, get a few.  One last thing to mention is expect to wait in line.  Don't think you can go at 10am, when they open, and beat the crowd.  Or, go at midnight thinking everyone's in the club or asleep.  Nope.  There will be a line.  Guaranteed.  But, they do have several lines when you actually get in.  One or two lines will have adobada, and other ones will have the other meats.  I want to say they go fast, but they don't.  They are fast making the food, but I think people order so much that it takes time.  The Adobada line does go fast though, for whatever reason.  P.S.  Don't forget the Horchata!!!
