4x0Jnxk3uqKx1uIDulU4Cw.text: A little whole in the wall where all the locals go and it is wonderful. The carne melts in your mouth. Service is so friendly.

pSFuyEM-ubepzsRcRkrcag.text: Once I got over my shock that they didn't have chicken, I was ready to order!!  I picked the Mexican Shwarma ( as another Yelper called the pork).  So glad I did.  It was delicious.  Not spicy( I got the sauce on the side) and very moist.  The corn tortillas had the perfect corny tasty to them.  I only wish I would have discovered this joint sooner.  My wife waited on a different line and got the carne asada taco.  She thought they were really tasty too.  As good or better than a taco in Socal.

Sm3BNljh3kwQIO_c5nYLUA.text: We know Tacos el Gordo because the owners are from Tijuna and the original restaurant. We're very exited to know that finally we have good Tacos al Pastor in town. Tacos are good, the green sauce with avocado I would like more without mayo. Love that they open 24/7. Portions are good size.  My only suggestion to this place is your security people, are very rude with customers, probably you can higher a better company.

6hTdWcQ7JQWo6_ldLnm_qA.text: We had to check this place out, since so many people recommended this place. The wait was about one hour and a half. Not worth it ! The meat was not fully cooked and the tacos were tiny. I also ordered a Sope and it's not your typical Sope. It has cheese and meat and a bit of salsa. I asked for extra salsa and did not get it. I was very disappointed, not sure if they were just having a bad day.

GP4uYZIJONZAumgBidGF0g.text: I loved the atmosphere and the great customer service. We had tacos asada and whipped fruit drinks.  The tacos were delicious.  Fresh tomatoes,  onions, avocados,  salsa and meat seasoned to perfection.  We went in and had to ask for help placing an order.  Slightly confusing at first. There were 5 ordering stations. Each station had a cook preparing your food to order. The drinks are unlimited and tasty. The whipped drinks were tasty. The seating is outside under a covered canopy. There were two attendants under the canopy.

5K4vRqTxDmEJFt0vlRxqGg.text: Went here because it was open late and had good reviews. The food was pretty disappointing. The meat is cooked right in front of you, but it was pretty low quality and had lots of fat and gristle.

NVlYd6tIOf0aP5MMDVoE1A.text: Extremadamente recomendado ! You can't leave Vegas without coming to this place... Debes de probar las de tripas y las quesadillas y obviamente con todo!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NSz_SkQ4-7d1sURx-I6rvg.text: BEST TACO SPOT EVER!!! I'm not even exaggerating everything here is good mulas, tacos, asada fries!!

n5-6cEIItFVGAB2Dak9Qlg.text: Very disappointed. We even took an uber here. I've had it once in Texas and that one was good. I thought this location was not good at all. It's just outside the strip by a little and it's so getto. From the servers to the people dining there and even the taxi that we took back. The plaza is super getto, mind you we went around 11pm... which isn't even late in Vegas time.   The beef was dry. Asked for pineapple and the ppl give you looks. Would never go back

YRNKLgyjUIoUZAxP6x0D_A.text: Was told by all the locals to stop by here for amazing, authentic street tacos. I don't know why I was expecting to be blown away (coming from Texas, home of the famous Tex Mex), but it just tasted like any other street taco you can find in Dallas. There sure was quite a wait, so be prepared to have all your afternoon plans cancelled or delayed because there is no way you'll get in and out of there in less than an hour.

iLntAaXSRrWS0nWnDsw8GA.text: Went there last night. These tacos are simply the best I've ever had. The meat was so tasty and the hand-made tortillas were soooo good. Lines were long, but the wait was worth it. I guess the only downfall is that there's different lines for different kinds of meat, and also that there are no seats available because they are sooo busy.  But the tacos are sooo good that all those little things dont matter. We are going back again today!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular tacos and an Azteca taco, which has nopales in it.

CZJeYWxg9pYjdZQ_H911Kg.text: Carne asada is cooked well. My only complaint is the spice level of the salsa they put on and the $13 cost of carne asada fries. But I guess this is Vegas right.

Mnx-bsDsZtMq08xm7lZx4Q.text: This place is a must every time I'm in Vegas. The long lines are worth the wait. Their tacos are the best!

DozGYx8xoeyJRmw9v1DERQ.text: This place was worth the 11 minute walk from the Fashion Show Mall, right pass the Encore/Wynn hotel at the very north end part of the main Vegas strip. I sought out this place based on its glowing reviews so I had to try it. We got there around 3pm on a Sunday afternoon and there was a line but it moved pretty fast. I decided to try the Asada Taco, Abodada Taco and a small order of the Abodada fries. They were all packed with flavor. I was happy I made the trip. They have about maybe 15-20 tables and maybe 2 were available when we were ready to sit and chow down. They are busy and it makes sense why since they offer good tasting fast food for a great cost. Service was also very friendly. I'm a happy customer. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobada Taco &amp; Asada Taco
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small order of Adobada Fries $6
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very cheap but tasty food!

Fqrko2CPrUrgO-V2Md65og.text: Al pastor is really good. I've had the tostada and I wasn't impressed. Carne Asada is very tasty as well.

n5pWuGhisypM5JKboy6PAA.text: After going to Vegas so many times all I would ever hear about is Tacos El Gordo so I decided to finally give it a try I was let down a little now before I start would I go back ? Yes I would now I'll explain my 3 star rating I had a few different things wanted to get a taste for a little of everything I had the al pastor and boy was that amazing I recommend that 100% now I had a "quesadilla" big let down it was basically a taco with a sad little strip of cheese on it if that wasn't enough I had gotten it with chorizo it was so burnt!!! I couldn't even taste the chorizo why even serve it ? Now as for the salsa nothing is spicy but so much flavor !!! Now if you want some heat they do provide grilled peppers as well as onions the onions didn't seem grilled more like steamed wasn't a fan of the flavor the line set up is very ridiculous to say the least it's a mess and needs to be fixed to be honest I don't see how it works all and all I rate this place a 7/10 just for the al pastor I would come back because it's that amazing and definitely check your chorizo before paying lol

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MsXqojEHncE_XiK1V4wrZQ.text: The Tacos are very tasty and delicious, especially the Al Pastor/Adobada. The first time we went, it was very packed! It took us about 30 minutes before we got to order our food. So if you are starving like I was, maybe it's not the best option, but the wait is totally worth it. This last time we went, there was hardly any line, people do orders many tacos, so that could also be time consuming. But other than that, it's a nice place to eat at when in Las Vegas. It's always a must.

eX3nfMAtiR1F0vS4BAY-Kw.text: I'm only giving it one star because I have to but other than that very upset bad service bad cashier service because the guy was behind the tacos were great but when you go up to pay that cashier Blondie is a handful and she almost got a handful tonight

YzKzFKhXYnLTFIgVx5MB3g.text: My boyfriend took me here after a long drive to visit him and HOLY SHIT. Where has this been all my life? If I wanted legit warm, meaty and delicious tacos I'd definitely say this takes the cake. We ordered a bit of everything including capecheta fries which is huge! Late night dining is when it's most busy, so look out of for that, but it's definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Al pastor tacos

zU9_P5jZ0J1b3_jywD0ubg.text: Came here on a trip to Las Vegas.  Family was hungry, so we decided to try this taco place. I'm not sure what the hype is...  First of all, it's ABSOLUTELY STUPID to order first and pay after. You get your food, you have to wait in ANOTHER line AGAIN to pay. They count the food on the plate and give you the total. By the time you pay, the food is already COLD.  Who in their right mind thinks ordering, then paying while your food gets cold is a good idea?!  Not to mention that there's too many lines and it's just.. ugh, completely ridiculous and this place needs some serious organization.   Food was alright. It was good, but nothing to go crazy for, really.   Not sure if I'll stop by again in the future.

gRby7RrgepwAiJw-0aIV4A.text: Great authentic Mexicana. Food is wonderful. The atmosphere is awesome. Be patient. Very inexpensive. Whales to regular folks all elbow to elbow and digging in on some grub.

7l29nD-h50WCd0EF5pNAkw.text: I ordered a Mula and some tacos de asada but my number one choice are the tacos. The tacos are bomb!! The only thing you need to have is patience to be waiting in line to order your food.

MiJTRnqet__11XW92u0WBw.text: I've heard a lot about this place, have yet to try it, until yesterday. I got 5 carne asada tacos, and oh man, they were on point. I like the variety of salsa they offer, and I gotta say, their salsa is better than most other places. I didn't get to try anything else, but if you want good tacos, I can definitely recommend this place. Service was fast, although I did go when it wasn't so busy. 5 stars though for making my belly happy lol

gmLY0430fsdNitDP-CnASw.text: Best tacos in Vegas!!! The line is worth the wait. I have too come every time I visit Vegas.  The guys on the grill work hard. Carne Asada is grilled perfectly and season well(but not overly salted)

mGtgYCZjvoysSpBt9kKFGQ.text: Came here on a trip to Las Vegas and I was amazed. The reviews are all 100% accurate! Best tacos ever! I used to say that you have to drive to TJ to actually get authentic meat, and fresh hands made tortillas, but this place proved me wrong. There tortillas are made to order, there meat is soft , tender and so good! There product is fresh- from the guacamole to the sauces and Chile's- and there prices are so reasonably cheap! Everyone needs to stop here when they go to Vegas.

SsEVxuE8fwaxuV_odIXDHA.text: On our way back home from Vegas, one friend in our group highly recommended this place and we stopped by around 11:30 on a tuesday to find a packed house! the lines move fast, and when i say lines it is because one line kind of diverges into two, the first counter allows you to order certain meats and plates, the counter around the corner has difference options then a separate line to pay for the meal  everything looked so damn good i couldn't decide so i ordered: 2 tacos de al pastor 2 tacos de Buche 1 Sope de asada 1 Horchata all came to about $15   and holy shit from the first bite of each taco and sope, this was instantly the best mexican food i have ever had!!  the al pastor was to die for! each and every piece cut from the al pastor tower was crispy with the flavorful and broiled bark, so juicy and a little kick oh just wonderful the buche was  tender, so juicy and greasy, amazing porky flavor the sope oh man, nice size, crispy from the flat top, cheese guac veggies and the asada was bbq galore literally every bite had me shaking my head, wanting more, and experiencing a flavor and taco and plate that i had never had before from los angeles!  the horchata was a nice refresher too, especially from the machine  this place is a definite new spot to visit every damn trip! DO NOT GO TO VEGAS WITHOUT STOPPING HERE!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left: tacos de Buche top:tacos De al pastor right: Sope de asada

QHkuB-X6nRPfWOK42DHMiw.text: I'm not sure I can anything new to all the other reviews. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is the standing in line for 30 minutes to order and get food. The food worth the wait though and I'll be back. I had the Tacos Al Carbon, Carne Asada Taco, and Chorizo Taco. All were full of flavor and had fresh ingredients. Be aware that there is no chicken served at this restaurant and limited seating during the busy times of day, which on the Las Vegas strip is most of the day and evening.   Skip the chain type Mexican restaurants over at the fashion mall food court or casino hotels and come here. I had 4 tacos for under $10 and walked out full. Its only a 5 or 10 minute walk from Wynn/Encore,Trump, Fashion Mall and the convention center area.   Wish they would open a location at McCarran Airport D Concourse!

U5DaxEaeqLlcF98-PF9Apw.text: Omg,  seriously worth the visit! It's been a month since I've been there because I'm from Chicago.  I obviously Can't stop thinking of these tacos since its been a month and wish i could have some more now.  Since i can't hopefully you will have one for me!  I can't wait to go back to Vegas for these tacos! I'm more excited for these tacos than the gambling or the strip!

mveXAFeK_C5Io3Eb8059cQ.text: After a long conference day, ended up eating Tacos El Gordo with some amazing people I met.   Ordered 5 tacos (adobada and carne asada).  I loved the hand made tortillas and all the toppings they put on the tacos.   The place gets packed and you'd have to be lucky to find a spot inside, away from the Vegas heat.   Great for a quick bite. This place is away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, but worth the drive.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v9Xti5lyayDySsTKVt5AWA.text: Excellent tacos! The wait is worth it. The al pastor tacos are fabulous and worth the 30-min wait in line for them.   For the al pastor tacos, the pork is sliced off the gyro-machine thing, served with toppings that include a cilantro-y green sauce. Meats, sauces, and onions served on two small corn tortillas.   There are various options including mulas, quesadillas, tacos with various meats, and fries (loaded or plain).  This is a unique place with 3 different lines, indoor and outdoor seating, and an order first then pay concept. The wait will be long so be patient and these tacos are worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d9cmLAGFCTG0v7gpv_hmLA.text: Tacos El Gordo after a long night of wholesome fun on The Strip is quite the experience. I've had Tacos El Gordo down in San Diego and definitely a fan so why pass up the opportunity to grab some tacos here in LV.  Line up for the type of meat you're interested in ordering from adobada, carne asada and another for less popular meat choices. Grab your food, pay at the cashier, load up on salsas and other condiments and enjoy.  They have hand-pressed, made from scratch tortillas and a variety of meats to choose from. My fave has always been Al Pastor with everything on it and the bit of pineapple with it is like the cherry on top. Do yourself a favor and slap on their green sauce, it's fire!   Prices are reasonable for solid tasting tacos and perfect as a meal sober or not. Lines are out the door, but move pretty fast. No issues hailing Lyft or Uber to and from here as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

cEhl6CZy0_v9UmlWSIqIQw.text: I came on a Sunday at 4 pm with really no wait - whoo hoo! I can see it being madness after the club with all the drunk people which I def wanted to avoid! Here's the breakdown:  There's a total of 4 lines: 2 for the famous adobado (which is al pastor), 1 for carne asada, and 1 for other misc meats.   Get in the correct line, order, wait for them to cook and hand you the food (which is super quick) and then head over to the cashier on the right to pay!   You can have any "vampiro style" aka their version of a quesadilla. Basically same as a street taco but with a different tortilla and added cheese. Good!  You can ask for onions and chilis when they cook your food at no extra cost.  The sauces are good but say no to the salsa if you can't eat spicy like me!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The adobada (al pastor) tacos here are the BEST!!! Skip the dry, flavorless carne asada!

Y8iiO5M5PeXWroppcq2DMQ.text: Wow, just wow...there's really no better way to describe these tacos.  Located in a strip mall just up the block from Wynn, TeG serves up the tastiest authentic Mexican tacos I've ever come across.  Friendly service, super reasonable prices and everything made fresh to order.  I sampled four varieties, all with everything on them:  1.  Suadero - tasty but a tad on the salty side.  Not bad by any means, but my least favorite of what I sampled.  2.  Chorizo - very tasty, not sure it even needed the guacamole on top but a very good option.  3.  Asada - simply amazing, the steak has a melt in your mouth consistency that I can't do justice to in words.  Would be the best of all if not for...  4.  Abodaba - holy crap these are good!  That freshly sliced pork and the green sauce on top are a marriage made in heaven.    On return i'd probably stick to the asada & abodaba as they were head and shoulders above the other stuff, nothing here was bad but they were the truly memorable ones.  If you're in town and craving what tacos should taste like get here, get on the right line (different stations have different taco types), grab a mandarina to wash it down with at the cashier and dig in, you'll have a happy belly for sure.

d_HuwbqVIDFoKuVnjPV8iQ.text: It wouldn't be a complete Las Vegas trip without a pit stop to Tacos El Gordo. Best taco place hands down. I just wish there was one closer to my hometown! There's a reason why the lines are through the door no matter what time of day it is.   The service is great and they are so quick to make and serve you your tacos. The prices are very affordable and the taste is out of this world! Tortillas are hand made and you can definitely taste the authenticity. Next time you're in Vegas looking for a great munchies spot this is the place!!

T-LH8KFM3SWDiWd83BjgDQ.text: A friend of ours kept talking about how fabulous this place was so we decided to ride out with them out here.   Holy crap. This place had the BEST tacos we've probably ever had.   When you first walk in it's very hard to understand where to order what. They have different lines based on what you want to order. We got the spicy pork and steak tacos, and my husband got a quesadilla too.   The tortillas are made as you're ordering. It's completely fresh. The meats are then cooked right in front of you.   The seating is limited so it's hard to find seats but we sat comfortably outside. Not great if you have a big party with you.   All of our friends were talking about the horchata and how amazing it was. We would DEFINITELY go back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9ZPsXLcJeWdweDSGrzFuDA.text: Really good taqueria down the strip.  Tried a few of their tacos and the adobada tacos which is basically tacos al pastor with the red sauce on it are probably their best tasting ones.  The salsa they put on top is good and not that spicy.  If you're afraid of spicy stuff you should be fine.  If you don't know Spanish or are confused just look for the red pork slices on a rotating vertical stick with a pineapple on top.  It's our version of shawarma.  Tacos El Gordo for some reason has two locations pretty much smack next to each other.  The other location which is a few buildings down looks to be newer and had a shorter line than the one we went too.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobada tacos

ulvqsrWc26e9-JjpZbFttQ.text: This is honestly the best taco place in town! It was so good that I came back the next day!   This restaurant is a little far down the strip, across from Circus Circus, but is so worth the drive. I was a little confused upon entering the place because there are multiple lines.   There are 3 lines divided based on what you are ordering. The line can get long sometimes, but don't be discouraged because they work QUICK!  I ordered the adobada al pastor, carne asada, and suadero. My favorite by far was the adobada al pastor. It's cool because you can see them shave the meat off the spinning meat thing. The carne asada was good, but not one of my favorites. The suadero was delicious and juicy, probably my second favorite.   I wish their menu had a description of everything because I would have loved to try other things if I understood what they were. I give this place 5 stars because not only is their food good, but I have never seen employees work so quick to make tacos! They can make 3 tacos in seconds... it's crazy! I definitely plan to come back next year.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Suadero
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adobada al pastor

DrQyijRKLMn_2J4g-WIp_g.text: I beat myself up for a year because the last time I tried coming here a year ago they were closed due to a possible gas leak.  This place is EXTREMELY overhyped.  Out of the three Al Pastor tacos we had two of them were dry. The asada was just ok. But the lengua was delicious!  We also tried our at at some carne asada fries which I'll have to say are just ok. If you're considering them, just pass.  I also recommend coming with a couple of friends if you guys want to try different meats since there are four different lines you have to stand in in order to get the meat of your choosing.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada fries, carne asada tacos, al pastor tacos, and lengua tacos.

XizSy_pkyKMpYO5ZBi5jCQ.text: Glad to finally have tried this place! I been hearing about this place for awhile! The line goes by quickly ! However the inside is just super packed and hot! I would recommend taking the food to go! The carne asada is so delicious and fresh! The extras are delicious too! They put guac and cilatro and onions on the tacos! So much flavor! I would recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 carne asada tacos

UXhNzfuvt8QCaj13NbiAfg.text: As close as you can get to the other side of the border for some traditional street tacos.   The vibe here is your favorite vacation Mexican taco spot for sure! Lines out the door, patio seating full and tacos tacos tacos!   They are pretty organized here. One line for your typical and approachable carne asada(grilled beef) another line for trompo and adobada ( sliced seasoned pork with or without pineapple) and one more for cabeza, lengua, tripas and other beef parts (head, tongue, intestines).   Try the trompo, that would be the line with the red seasoned pork meat upside down looking Christmas tree. Do yourself a favor and have the full traditional experience by ordering the grilled pineapple to go with your trompo tacos and ask for your salsa on the side. The red is tangy and hot, the green is milder. They also have an avocado sauce that pairs well with any of the meats.   If you order any of the other meats ask for the grilled onion and peppers on the side. These are available when you order your tacos and not at that lime and condiment bar by the drinks paying line.  Tip: cash only, so don't forget your wallet.   This place is a must when you visit Las Vegas. They have another location steps away closer to Charleston corner. I discovered it while walking back to my car. That location is not as busy and has the same quality of food.   Parking is nearly impossible here on a weekend. I had to park by a nearby pharmacy a block away but definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tripas, buche, and cabeza station.  Super cool and friendly service.
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trompo
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty legit al pastor tacos.

EfyBR0AKuZMTJJrjxsPqiA.text: Hands down the BEST tacos in Las Vegas!   I was told by my uber driver to try this place for the best tacos, so my friend and I decided to go and try it out!   First I have to say, if you're going, give yourself some time as both locations (located across the street from each other) have lines at all times they are open.   The way you order can be a bit confusing since you have separate lines for different kind of tacos. When you walk inside there's lists of the kind of tacos that they have at that particular line. So be prepared to stand in two or three lines if you want different tacos.   Now the food.... it is amazing! I ordered the chorizo, al pastor and carne asada tacos with a carne asada quesadilla. So yes I stood in two lines! The meat was flavourful and the tortillas are HAND MADE in front of you! The tortillas taste fresh and delicious! Fresh guacamole, salsa, coriander (cilantro) and onions make the whole taco's taste come to ode in your mouth!   There are agua fresca, which comes from a fountain dispenser. I was pleasantly surprised it taste fresh.   Price is very reasonable and seating is limited to inside and outside table areas. Since it's so crowded, table sharing is a must.   Glad my uber driver told me about this spot. It is a bit away from the "main" stop part, but well worth the walk/uber/taxi ride there!   The location is towards the circus circus part of the strip and located in a strip mall that looks shady. But no worries, it was completely chill. Again, these are typically the best spots to find the best food!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu! And different lines for different tacos!
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food prep in front of you as you order

_Sc035fXVFjQBEOFX9O-0A.text: As someone who lived in San Diego for over 5 years, Tacos El Gordo has become a part of life - something we need to "inject" into our system once in a while... For me, ever since I moved away from San Diego, this store has been doing just that... And it never disappointed. The lengua tacos are just as good as the original!  I've brought friends here a few times and they all ended up having the best tacos they've ever had.  Tips: the carne asada line is always very long, I recommend going to the lengua line and get lengua instead. Even if you don't want lengua... The asada line is NOT the only line; there are a few other lines, usually much shorter... Just go around the asada line and you'll see them.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-jNjRS82qqxbDBhaaa0bCw.text: The al pastor/adobada!! I always get it whenever I'm here. From the first bite to the last, every bite was just tear jerkingly perfect. I cannot emphasize how good the corn tortillas are even on its own. This is legit the GOAT HAHA I want to try the other types of tacos here but I always stick with the al pastor. I can't help it! It's just that good! Ooh they also sell palette from La Michoacana if you want ice cream after

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WaHnVZmuhCmD-NuwlihgfQ.text: What a great little find. Street tacos in Las Vegas, hard to believe but they are here. Tacos asadas, adobadas, lengua, tripas and more. The tacos are prepared right in front of you.  The service is as fast as can be given the long lines. So be prepared to wait. It's worth it.

Xz8M_bA1vAyI2gtSJvsh-g.text: Tacos El Gordo has 3500 reviews averaging 4 stars didn't hit the spot for me and wondering why people thought it was the best meal they had in Vegas.  Here is the run down.  - The tortilla did not taste home made.  I saw bags of store bought tortilla in the back which was disappointing. - The meat was just ok, it did not tatse like it was grill on charcoal. - No salsa bar.  - You have to wait in different lines for different meat.  Overall, at $2.40 a taco, the value wasn't there.  No home made tortilla, no salsa bar, meat lacking the grill meat flavor.  Maybe I been spoiled living in San Jose for the last 25 years. Make sure you plan accordingly, it's a popular tourist spot.  Taco El Gordo is located way down the strip pass Wynn Casino.  Not worth the drive.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prepping the Al Pastor
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream

RFg0xZXRZjFuRg5ruJMkzg.text: This place is packed and busy! It really does have the best tacos on the strip. The food is supper fresh. They cook the meat in front of you and you can smell it being cooked and hear the sizzle from the grill. Next they heat the tortillas on the grill next to the meat to make them nice and tasty. The chief chops everything and dumps it on top of your tortillas. It's great how they do everything in front of you so you actually know what's going on your plate and that's how their tacos are put together. Lastly on the way to pay you add the condiments you want with your taco. The lines are super crazy but these workers really work fast to help it move along. The only thing I wished was better was if they had more seating because it's so packed. It's far one of the best taco places I have ever went to.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MfwPmI_DTREGkjD7UYBo_g.text: Great taco spot in the middle of a lot of higher end eatery's. Tacos El Gordo is a perfect break from a lot of the formal dining places in LV.  The prices are affordable and the food is made fresh. One of the coolest parts of the place is watching the cooks assemble the food and sear meet in front of you.  We didn't have much of an appetite but that didn't stop us from ordering an absurd amount of fries. The Carne Assad's Fries($13) was a nice treat and had good flavor. Could of used some more sauce, as the meat and fries make it alittle salty and dry.   Also was able to try a few pork tacos($2.40/e), and they were on par with the rest of the food.  Lines were super long on a mid-week afternoon, so be prepared to wait for the food(Meat) you want to try

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Tacos
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Fries
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Fries($13)

5vkMY80o0MJzf7CHP_EboQ.text: Hands down the best tacos I've ever had. If you take anything away from this review that's honestly all you need to know, but for fun I'll dive into more detail.  I went to this restaurant late after a night out on the strip and expected it to be empty when I got there wrong 1am but it was packed! After tasting the food I don't blame everyone though it's amazing! I tried the pork taco, pork quesadilla, and a beef taco. While the signs were confusing and a couple workers were kinda rude after I guess I lined up in the incorrect spot (despite the signs saying I should order the pork taco/quesadilla where I had lined up), I still highly recommend this restaurant. The meat was absolutely amazing and I would encourage you to try a variety, but if I had to recommend one it would be the pork. Expect some decent lines especially during meal times or super late when people are leaving the strip but the lines move quickly and they are definitely worth the wait!

M4CLnzBVsPRV7MSGXixdOg.text: This place is ok. Tacos are way to expensive for what you get, $2.20 per taco. No where near TJ style tacos... fast food and fast service however setup is lame. You order and get hot tacos (food) than you stand in long line with food in hand to pay. By the time you pay your food is cold. They have to come up with a better plan, totally inefficient business process. However I don't think they would care since it's always packed in there.

FOPJ1nPbL179n4RtfmngqQ.text: It was okay...I don't know what all the fussy is about.  I ordered like 4 taco sized things and 1 Carne Asada fries.  $35 with 2 drinks.

4IfirfBvc8_BwJA5F6Gw_Q.text: Fabulous food.  The atmosphere is an experience!  Don't miss this if you like great food and prefer authentic!

DnVVKkPHfxK51AOkncaqUQ.text: The 5 stars are for the Adobada tacos.  SO. GOOD.  The  cooks are in different stations so it's not too long of a wait. Only downside is that it gets really crowded.. But for Adobada, it's worth it.  I'm so sad they only have 4 locations, and none in the Los Angeles area.. Boo. Oh, and don't forget to ask for a slice of pineapple on top of your Adobada taco! I wonder how many times I said Adobada in this post.. Adobada. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Long line, but not going out the door yet haha

iDY7eqcJx_ScYejOCWcSzg.text: Amazing food -must have in Vegas. Get the beef tongue fries for the table and dont forget the complimentary jalapenos and grilled green onions.  Tacos are around 2 bucks. Favorite was the spicy pork. Lines can get long but they are pretty efficient.  Get a minimum of 4 tacos btw if you are not sharing the fries.

XoL_-dPNo5v1TuWpzNn0Xw.text: Not cheap but authentic,  long lines and different lines depending on the taco you want to order so if you want 3 different tacos you get to wait in 3 different lines.   I guess that makes sense if you're use to using the metric system or something lol

U5beTsb7U0XrAXGM8G-dHg.text: The line was long,but the food is very, very good! I recommend eating the beef tongue. Since the taco is very small, I recommend getting 3-6 tacos.If you want more or less, go for it! If you live out of Las Vegas, this is a must eat!

rbd-lRaB6W5ucG-enlWuxg.text: Not my favorite.  This is the 3rd time I have been here.  I wanted to give it the benefit of the doubt and went back but I dont think I will be back.  The lines are always ridiculous, no type of organization and barely any room to fit customers who want to dine there.  Aside from these, my main complaint is the steak itself, I was not a fan.  Kind of flavorless and chewy.  I guess I was expecting more.  There are better taco places in the area.

zBVPb1UyObuA8XI14kwQJw.text: Very busy. Open all night. Extremely cheap. Authentic as all get our. The beef tongue was out of this world delicious. Walking distance on the strip. Awesome

wOqbk5ZAAjyeD26WEXw2LQ.text: I love, love, love al pastor, when it is done right, and this place does it to perfection! They slow roast the pork on a spit with a pineapple that sits on top and drips its juice onto the meat while it's cooking. Then they shave off pieces of the pastor and put it into your taco. What more could you want! I will add that it's in a ghetto part of Vegas and there's a methadone clinic right down the road. So if your cool with being in the sketchy area, it's a great dive restaurant to hit up for delicious eats.

Exlho_9sUQwS8zX8J92gpw.text: Simple and old school food. Just a place if you want to sit down. I tried something I've never had before. de Buche? (Pork stomach) all in all not bad. I think it's just knowing what it was I had to get over.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street food feel. I was satisfied.

EIqzZS11qW-QKvsrTRPO0A.text: LENGUA here is the BEST I've ever had.  Every piece was so incredibly tender and flavorful.  You can't even taste little bumpy taste buds.  I don't even care if you're scared of trying lengua... get over it!  Living in Norcal, carne asada fries here were a nice treat because they make it Socal style wtih fries, lots of meat, cheese, sour cream, and guac.  $10 for a huge styrofoam container full.  You can easily share this among four people in addition to your tacos.  Docking 1 star because the pork adobada gave me diarrhea.  How to order?  You wait in one of the many lines.  Tell the cook what you want and they will make it for you as you wait in front of them.  Then take your tray of food to the cashier, order a drink if you want, and pay.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada fries

xF3vxZO9KJjM7AEUXy9Ipw.text: The best place for tacos on the strip. Hands-down. Late night does get busy sometimes but it's worth the wait. Friendly staff. Excellent cooks

Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nXkrNP33yRKrXzjKT7PXJQ.text: I've had a lot of tacos in my life and I can say without a doubt these are the best tacos on the planet.  My favorite is the pork adobada but all of it is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cKvuJvxQ9Nmf2l8781SwCg.text: THIS IS A GEM OF A FIND ON THE STRIP! Once you are all buffet'd out and are looking to save money without sacrificing quality, then this is your spot! It's perfect walking distance from the Riviera and the Wynn. These guys are open late into the early hours especially on fridays and saturdays. They have some booths inside but most of the seating is located outside in two decent sized tents which you cant miss if you're driving by on the street. On cold nights they have those gas powered heating elements for those of you that think Vegas doesnt get that cold. The parking is decent and on some nights you have street racers meeting up here just to hang out. Im suprised this location doesnt have an armed security guard like the Charleston location. As for the food, the three most popular items that I usually get here are the El Pastor tacos, Carne Asada tacos, and the Adobado Fries. The tacos are 2 bucks a pop and the Adobado Fries are 5 bucks for the half order and 10 bucks for a large order (the half order is virtually a meal in itself!). You have the option of having everything on your tacos and fries at no extra charge. These are the guacomole sauce, onions, and cilantro for your tacos. For the fries you can get sour cream, guacomole, and extra cheese. You can even ask for grilled green onions and jalapenos on the side. Also you can have them put grilled pineapple bits as well, BUT YOU HAVE TO SPECIFICALLY ASK FOR THESE so if you dont than they will not give it to you. That's why I love these guys, no extra charge for all those mentioned above. I also like this place better simply because of the fact that they have TWO service stations meaning they have twice the amount of food servers and cashiers (yes they take cards and there is no minimum) which equals faster service although on really busy nights you cant tell. Plus, it seems that they speak better english here than the other location. yelp.com/biz/tacos-el-go... If you are up for it, there is another place that serves an even better El Pastor. They are a couple miles away on Charleston just down the street from the other Tacos El Gordo. They are called Taqueria El Pastorcito. When you go East on Charleston, look for the trailer with the bright lights on the left side of the street just right before Los Tacos on the right side. yelp.com/biz/taqueria-el...

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hungry?
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Al Pastor Tacos and a Half Order of Adobada Fries!

qzQkgkiE6O5FiUpQyL7N_Q.text: I always come here for my tacos pastor if I'm in need while in the area. waiting is never a long issue, and my food is always fresh! would recommend to anyone. They also have REALLY good carne.

zRM4k59uzI-OnX0gqO0EVg.text: I had the al pastor tacos and holy shit. People aren't joking about the line but it was worth it 100x over. The tacos were delicious and way cheaper than a lot of other food near the strip. Definitely recommend getting more than you think you want. I instantly regretted not buying more when I finished mine. Will be returning to this little gem when I come back to Vegas.

3eUFQqOxcogFPoq0xE9Yxw.text: Best tacos de pastor north of Tijuana MX.... hands down the best! Las Vegas is a place of glitz and glamour, fine dining and awesome entertainment, yea, yea... but sometimes you need to have the simple things in life to make your day special! That my friends is Tacos El Gordo! Don't be fooled by imitators, or copy cats, Tacos El Gordo are a must have and are simply awesome!! Be prepared to wait in line and make sure you educate yourself before standing in line. They have a great system which separates the customers based on which types of tacos / food you want. At the store near the Wynn on the strip, tacos de pastor only goes to the left, all other meats are to the right. Stand in the proper line and you'll get served pretty quick. Once you order and get your food, you find a spot to sit and then go pay. It's kind of like an honor system to letting the cashier know what you have ordered, so don't try to jip them!!   The tacos de pastor are my favorite as are the Vampiros. The corn tortillas are hand made for all tacos so get ready for that!! The vampiro is sort of like a taco sandwich. The tortillas are over cooked and turned into a tostada, then the meats are piled on the bottom one, melted cheese follows, then salsa and onions and cilantro. Topped off with another crispy tortilla and there you have it.. vampiro awesomeness!!  If you like tacos, you'll LOVE Tacos El Gordo!

kAnMzILG8pCr-fgakKKiAA.text: Crazy busy, if you haven't been before look for a local to help you thru the chaos. Food was good well portioned for price and fast for the most part. Be prepared always busy and very few places to sit.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UpjaMPdDSMOQ9L9iSaOaag.text: Delicious tacos and a bargain at 2.25 a taco. Tacos El Gordo is extremely authentic and you can watch the staff cook and prepare your meal.  Everything is in Spanish so it was a little difficult to understand the menu.  This place always seems to be busy and we waited in line for around 45 minutes until we could place our order and we ate outside since their wasn't any indoor seating available.
