Yj_pMCtrOWnn062ZgzCAYw.text: This is probably one of the best taco spots in Vegas!! The staff is friendly and the tacos are BOMB!! I recommend eating here if you're visiting Vegas

TyDtAUteQVHufvtzJHgPDA.text: Great tacos!!! I've been to the location in Chula Vista but was not impressed. I don't know what it is about this place but the tacos de al pastor and tripas were the best. Salsas are great, everything is fresh. The downfall to it is that you have to wait in line to get in and than when inside the lines are split. Kinda confusing but definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vmcYZYRZXEDeZhWaQEjM-Q.text: Ok, this is a MUST STOP place whenever we are anywhere near the area! The el pastor tacos are the absolute best! You'll need at least five

GRhOLNqAMULhcIKX26rXHw.text: I believe this is a great place to eat at if one is hungry around Vegas and is feeling some Mexican food. This restaurant is also located in San Diego and they both deliver great cheap Mexican food. Keep in mind when you order food, you first get the food up on the counter then take it to the back to process your payment. I feel like customers could just skip the payment lol, but I guess they believe the honor code here in Vegas.  Now the foood! I got the cabeza and al pastor taco which were both great and flavorful. The cabeza was awesome and just melted in your mouth. I also got the lengua fries, which was only tasty on the top. The reason is because there's no Flavoring on the bottom. The sauce and meat only exist on the top of the fries.   Overall, this place was solid but not the greatest. But if I'm around I'll definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3dEgu8YlCJlP5jy1Q0hRWA.text: Best tacos in Las Vegas!!  Spicy Pork is my favorite! Just a couple minutes away from the Strip. Little tacos with colorful vegetables and delicious pork. You can eat 4 and that's a meal.

a3s5XUN34R9EJTkDyrmThg.text: One of my favorite taco shops! Just wish there was one a little closer to home!

oW6beA0IgYLNqD2wsUpVZQ.text: Best tacos to date. There are separate lines for different types of meat. It's crazy! If there is a long line it is worth the wait! And it usually goes by pretty fast. It's a quick walk from the Wynn hotel. ;)

gC2pOuMYobPMN9HtWAOdMw.text: Terrific, Authentic mexican street food served fast and deliciously tasty. The beauty of this place is the simplicity of their setup. Cafeteria style with employees cooking right in front of you and ordering in a fast paced line. Lots of selections to choose from, varieties of tacos, quesadillas, sopas and more. Go here and youll never regret it.

TQEDadVn8m6siysoLJmASg.text: The food here is so GOOD! The make fresh tortilla for there tacos. I love the Taco Asada! Today I tried the FLAN OMG it is DELICIOUS!

qzT3kX5xFNCwkLzf3JX9sw.text: Just north of Encore and the Wynn is this amazing Taco stop! It's not far of a walk and expect to wait in line but it's amazing.  I'm a huge fan of tacos al Pastor so those are going to be my recommendation for you. Three tacos is good for me but I could have done more. Get it with everything and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GxqT_XgEcITwFOIx6jASeQ.text: I must say this is the best taco place hands down!!! Every time we are in town we have to make a stop here.  Prices are very reasonable and the food is amazing. The asada fries are so good too. I would so recommend this place to all my friends.

8IXmPQLKtZHd2sjz2aaN3w.text: I give you 2 stars well 3  your tacos are perfect just you need at little kick on your salsas  because your salsas are not spicy your salsa is sweet and at the same time sour  I'm a Mexican person  In your business you are going to find people from the all world  Because is Vegas.  Try to have salsas for everyone see you Nextime and I will be giving you another great review

jgzELI9wx95I9wxp-CeDWA.text: Love this late night taco place. It could be a little cleaner but the tacos are so good will definitely go back. Beef tongue and steak are my families favorite

8hZ08JCwh-wbuLZoJsjtIg.text: Totally worth the line in Vegas although should prob bring some water with you. Separate lines for the al pastor and carne guisada But was made right in front of you to order and with really fresh ingredients and tortillas. Hopefully the new spot will cut down the wait in line

TOI2ZL39iz0MBkE5wNHpuw.text: Delicious authentic Mexican food. The lines can get long but move quickly.  It is usually very crowded but people eat and leave so you can usually find a table shortly after you have your food.  There are no frills and the tacos are a little small so make sure you order enough. The sopes were really good not overly heavy. The meat has really good flavor and was tender. Make sure you get in the right line there is one for pork and one for beef.

7vdXiu2bqNUB4LhQuFmOgg.text: The spicy pork tacos are so damn good. I stop by here almost every time I am in Vegas. Looking forward to my next trip. Only reason it's not 5 stars is that they are overly expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy pork tacos
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The whole shabang

5QUNpDr7A-YkGxPF6UinLg.text: Tacos were the bomb.com The sope I had was carne asada & it was really good. (: Really disappointed their aguas weren't freshly made though, the machine ones aren't as good .

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XG9yEWuxAh4-lF5OXalG-Q.text: Great street tacos! You have to go in separate lines depending on which meat you want. The most popular al pastor and asada are of course in different lines so if you're looking to get both, I'd recommend having a friend with you. If you're going alone, go in the asada line first because it seems longer. That way your wait for al pastor is shorter and your food won't get cold.  I had both the asada and al pastor tacos and they were both really good. I think I prefer the al pastor a little more but you can't go wrong. I went there a little before 6PM and the line was about 6-7 parties outside the door. By the time I finished ordering and sat down, the line at least doubled in size.   They are open until like 5AM, but the late night rush is super busy so you'll be waiting for a while.

gd3qSq0ykvCQbFyQyyWIkA.text: Coming from LA with abundance of Mexican food, Tacos El Gordo had mediocre tacos with very little seasoning and flavor. The line to order was a chaos and not organized. The tables were not kept clean. The food was meh and the servers were not welcoming nor were they kind enough to explain which tacos are which. Wouldn't come back again.

_Jhh0auqhLIvix5FC_ioNw.text: My first Las Vegas trip was memorable for many reasons including these goddamn delicious tacos! Coming from the East coast, tacos adobada (pastor) are not a common sight. So imagine my awe when I see the workers slicing and chopping away at the meats, quickly preparing the tacos, and serving it up fresh. My only regret is not going there a third time before the end of the trip.

kdNvu7jM6kq_iHIvOmWOlw.text: Seriously, the best tasting tacos I've ever had! And also very affordable. Both the steak and chicken were so fresh!

z4hPrJ3v5J9-TYpypv8e4A.text: I loved all the tacos , I tried adobada, asada, buche y suadero. They were served with good portion of meat, grilled onions and jalapenos were also great

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos el Gordo adobada meat

hFk6VUMhXzBNimw2dcbR0w.text: Best.Tacos. Hands down. '  Unless you're in Mexico, you're not going to experience a better taco than here at Tacos El Gordo. We love the Al Pastor - it's perfection on a spit. The entire experience here feels genuine.   It's typically pretty easy to park, and unless you're in the touristy season, you can usually get in pretty quickly, although there are times when the line is out the door - which is insane.   We always head straight to the al pastor line and get three (at least) tacos each. They're served on small paper plates, double-corn tortillas, carved from the spit right in front of you. I love to watch the expertise, you can tell these guys have been doing this for a while, and man am I glad! The spice is on point, the sauce is heaven, and the size is perfection.   Inexpensive, perfect tacos is what you can expect here, along with Mexian sodas, horchata, and swift service. Yes, there are a ton of people here, but that's because it's incredible. Order more than you think you'll eat - because they disappear quickly from your plate. :)

kjuywbsGnqv_ZNETU5_-Ww.text: Food is consistent, staff are friendly, inside and outside seating are very clean. Best tacos is Las Vegas!

MpB3Ye3OQKnMlAjQg7QbQQ.text: Talk about a confusing layout. Uh oh!  For first-timers, know what you want ahead of time so that you don't crowd around the area. Once you walk in, you'll see that lines are sorted depending on the meat type you want, and things work quickly here so study your Spanish ahead of time kids! Once you walk up to a line that has your meat of choice, this is your chance to tell your chef what toppings you want (onions, cilantro, etc.) that's near them. Don't be shy now!   Also, they have these grilled green onions and peppers that you can ask for on the side just as an added taco comfort food (it's delicious btw!). The great thing about this place is that they cook your taco meat and put everything together in front of you so you know exactly what goes inside. Once you're done gathering your made-to-order tacos, you stop by the register at the right corner of the store. Pleaseeeee, remember to bring cash because there are times where the system goes down. Better safe than sorry!   Overall, my experience was up and down. I didn't know how to order, where to order, and how to react when the cashiers all of a sudden told me that the card reader stopped working. BUT! I'm hoping that with this review, you can be a whole of a lot better prepared than I was at that moment. Enjoy!

uHWWuNPWdV5nsaNo0phFdQ.text: it's good but it's a shit show! lines for every different tacos and paying your tacos get cold waiting in lines! they need a new system.

t5ktFLwufxj8BcXR7rIOag.text: Overhyped. Line was long. While standing in line, we decided we wanted to try the carne asada, tripe, and al pastor. Well, when we got inside, we saw that you have to stand in different lines depending on the food/type of taco you want. After standing outside and then standing in line again once inside, we decided that the al pastor and carne asada would be it. I wasn't going to stand in yet another line for the tripe. They really need to improve this system.  Al pastor tacos were fine. Carne asada tacos were bland and not good at all. Definitely not worth it. Would not recommend.

92xve-2ob2CGJxXM-AqcHg.text: Great place worth the wait and you will most likely wait because of the popularity of this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos

DCszHX-VS7CutQaA2a6Xcw.text: While the strop location isn't ideal for us locals, tourists this is a must try for cheap, quick eats. The inside confused me the first time I went but essentially you go to each taco station you want that type of meat from and add that many to your tray before taking your whole order to the checkout. If you go at peak times, waits can be long and seating sparse. As locals, I'd recommend this for a weeknight lunch or dinner to deal with less crowds.

lTAucpn4WB46BuBQ3dQskw.text: If I keep eating the delicious tacos at Tacos El Gordo, I'll become even more gordo myself.    Tacos El Gordo are the most authentic tacos this side of Tijuana, wait a sec ...

6FOh4d4Xqo9b26GEfjF0gA.text: My wife and I come here every year on our anniversary and stand in line for sometimes 40 minutes.  And that's at 1AM.  Very good, traditional tacos.  They are as good as any street taco I have had in Mexico.  There are only two downsides here:  1:  The wait can be very long  2:  There is very little seating for the size crowds that form at both doors so plan accordingly.

BCmblH6fpQzlXZrE4YJbCQ.text: Adobada tacos. SOOOO GOOD! No visit to Vegas is complete without a visit or two to this wonderful establishment. The food here is good any time of the day - breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night snack.  You order at each station (they all specialize in one/two types of meat). You get your food and pay at the cashier. The first time we went, it was empty and we were confused so the nice ladies walked us through the entire process very patiently. I will always make sure to make a visit here every time I visit Vegas. This place is THAT GOOD!

ZzUqWk1uYz4xYEQWvs0Aew.text: Omg best dam tacos ever.we come to vegas probably every four months weather it be for biz or play but every time its a must to have tacos here so if your in vegas and have a craving for mexican you must try this place.its right on the strip and open real late so weather its lunch or late nite after partying all nite munches this is where you must go.:D

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best tacos in vegas

7HLUQbED4zXkU-W-yCBaEw.text: I have yet to see a taco joint where they serve excellent tacos AND fries. Here, you are delighted to tacos of all kinds of meat from asada to lengua. So you won't be limited to only one particular kind of meat.  The tacos are seriously STUFFED with meat, onions, cilantro, and sometimes mild sauce or guacamole depending on what kind of taco you order. Just a tip for preferential purposes, you can even order corn tortillas which are somewhat bigger than the standard size tacos. Remember, you have to ask for all the sauces when you pay for your food.  On the other hand, they serve fries! Be mightily warned that the full size rack of fries is HUGE. So unless you have a somewhat normal appetite and stomach, feel free to order the full size, otherwise, I highly recommend the half rack so you can get some tacos. They have carne asada fries, but my favorite is the campechana fries. The campechana fries consist of asada and adobada(similar/identical to pastor). And included is your standard set of sour cream, onion, cilantros, guacamole, and etc.   This is conveniently located northbound on Las Vegas Blvd ahead of Wynn/ Encore. Which makes it the perfect place to fulfill your drunchies after a night at Surrender or XS.   So many good things to say about Tacos El Gordo but why the one subtracted star? Prices. Coming from LA, I don't think I ever paid $2 tacos. But unfortunately, I have no other choice but to pay the full admission for a single taco in order to fulfill my meticulous craving for Mexican food.

cs7bUeCpmD5uK2zhGLQHHQ.text: Best tacos in The USA! Cleanest facility I have ever visited. Soooo busy that it blows my mind. Well worth the wait! Everyone needs to eat at Tacos El Gordo!

JTe_kh1QRyeyd30m3z66fQ.text: Their Carne Asada is the bomb! Love coming to this place, espcially late night. Very affortable compared to other prices on the strip. The only downside is the space because of it being too popular. Coming here any time after midnight should not be a problem but if not you might have to eat in the car!

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy taco

5RpaJHouej4R3VXlVkxyvQ.text: I found out about this hidden gem while listening to the podcast Five Hundy by Midnight.  I am so glad that I decided to check it out.  It is located in a small shopping plaza between the Riviera and Encore, so it is a little bit of a hike to get to, but it is worth it.    I had three Adobada Tacos (spicy pork) and my wife had a Steak Taco and a Beef Tongue Taco.  The tacos also came with a plate of sauteed scallions and hot peppers.  All the food was wonderful, plus at no more than $2.50 a taco, the price is unbeatable.    This is a great find and I highly recommend anyone looking for an inexpensive meal to give it a try.

C486AOleNbn-Ag4Xy5FKWw.text: Best Mexican food ever! If you want really good Mexican food go there. Tortillas are handmade and honestly that is the best tortillas for tacos. And their asada fries are amazing!

lDxRD7SR4JYu37-O_wXK1A.text: WTF is this place??  They have an unnecessary and complicated way of serving customers. It's not one big line to place your total order, but several huge lines for every kind of taco they sell!  I ordered 2 of their tiny tacos and left....And what kind of Mexican street tacos have mayo??  I have had way better tacos elsewhere.  What a stupid and annoying place, that is all all hype!

7pelLsEsDtTE434Z8pUyxg.text: Great location right on Las Vegas Bvld! It is even better that It is opened late (i think 24 hrs?). I stopped by after a night of clubbing and drinking. It definitely hit the spot. Possibly the cheapest food on the Strip! Everything was salty IMO. A squeeze of lime made it better.  -Cow brain: yes you heard me! Try it. I had cow brain before and this was not too tasty and fresh. I think it lost some creaminess and the flavor was not working for me. Fun to try. Not the best I've had.  -Tripe - my second favorite. tripe was clean and tender.  -Beef shoulder - my favorite. Beef was tender.  -Lengua - It was not good. Too salty.  Would I come back? maybe if it was late and I was hungry. Good location but not the best tacos I've had.

Zfw9Xk0uSnhQE7FdQhtmrQ.text: Seriously the best taco place in Las Vegas. I've lived here for 8 years and I've never found a place as good as this. Roberto's is all right if you're looking for convenience cause there's one on every corner but if you're something top notch it's this, especially their Tacos de Adobada.   The only cons are that on certain nights the lines can be super long. I went last Thursday and the line was absurd. My brother and I had to wait 30 minutes and I am not exaggerating. But anyway, it usually shouldn't be like this. If you're looking for quality tacos, this is the place!

7BhBtMi56BEy7ipq1H8k3A.text: Let's be real... I love me some tacos and I'm gordo!  This place offers delicious tacos at really cheap prices.  The lines are never too long and there is plenty of parking outside.  When you are tired of hitting up the buffets at the casinos, drop by this spot...

INiqevpmrS4zfL-8dknyJw.text: Didn't know they had a Tacos El Gordo in Vegas!!!  Being the ONLY one on the strip, this place is chaotic after a night of clubbing. Bigger than the locations in San Diego, but essentially the same menu. I always get the adobada tacos so I stuck with that, but the line is pretty ridiculous. The only thing that keeps this from a 5 star review was that the meat was a little dry compared to what I'm used to in SD. Other than that, bombdotcom!

HU3gw9lyrkyb6MHR5_Ervg.text: Driving to Vegas our first stop was a taco place , of course "taco el Gordo " . Was my first time trying it , hands down best taco I've eaten  so far.  Fresh meat that cooks in front you ,grilled veggies , the employee are nice too. Great place worth every penny

wlCogW9HQIIWKgObJsZQzA.text: We had Tacos El Gordo last night for dinner.  The environment is hectic. The place was packed with people and there was a lot of confusion over the fact that you had to stand in different lines for different items. They are set up station style. This can be a little problematic if there is only one of you ordering but you want different things which is why the only thing I ordered was 8  Tacos De Adobada because I ended up in that line. Next time I will make sure there is at least 3 people with me so one person can stand in each line to order a variety.  The tacos were on your typical small duel corn tortillas flash fried in oil. The meat was sliced right onto the shells and then the tacos were dressed with fresh cilantro, red salsa, chopped onions and then a creamy avocado sauce.  Two thumbs up for the tacos. They were delicious and after we ate them I wish I had ordered about 4 more. There is just something about tacos in the west that are truly fantastic and you just cant beat the prices.

QD9zaa9c6gqR2FcKpzcIAw.text: Crowded like the border. That's when you know this place is really good. Can't go wrong with anything. If you are new to this place then I would recommend adobado. 4 stars because there arent enough tables.

POVAwNOVUhd5nI2vtbc1hg.text: Best tacos I have ever had, you need to try as much as you can if you are visiting and that's what I did . Will be back when we are in town.

qs2U1CG-6pDiLJMRJ2b60Q.text: What a great place to get some food when you are hungover and need some greasy tacos to ease that headache. Some things are great about this place and others that I could pass on.  The place was packed with people so there is a little of a wait for the tacos. There are multiple lines that you order from and only make a specific taco (ie: one line for carne asada tacos, one line for lengua and cabeza tacos, another line for adobado tacos, another for chorizo, etc). So if you want to try different types of tacos you pretty much have to stand in 3-4 different lines. The best way to get a variety of tacos to try here at an efficient rate is to come in a group of 5 and divide and conquer. I spent most of the time standing in line and trying to figure out a more efficient way of running the place instead of standing in multiple lines. You pay afterwards at the two different cash registers when you've picked up all of your food.  The best taco was the Adobado (sp?) - spicy pork. Loved it. So tasty and the sauce goes really well with it. The adobado quesadilla was great too.   Carne asada was okay but a little tough. I had it with some fries which made it pretty good.  The lengua was okay and it was all right with the fries we ordered.   The pork shoulder was dry and tough. I would pass on it the next time.  So all in all, the spicy pork is the one meat that I would come back here to eat. Props to the place for  having orange bang and all of the other fresca flavors. Free refills too! Great to have on a hot day in Vegas.  Seating is limited because there are only so many tables. If you're willing to sit outside in the heat, there is a tented area that has some additional seating.

keGTkxqNN0EFTe3HUP0gvg.text: They have a confusing system of ordering first at one of the two cooking stations then paying at one of the two cashier stations you hope have an employee at them so you know where to pay. I was so confused for the first 10 minutes I was there. That, and my arm got burned by a fleck of something that came off the grill across the way while I was just waiting for my food. I asked for a cup for water and was given one, but they didn't have a dispenser for water at either of their two drink fountains! I tried pulling the little tab under the Sprite that is normally water, but all I got was super flat and disgusting tasting Sprite. I  was super irritated!  Apart from that, the spicy pork tacos are epically amazing and deserve 5 stars alone. I wasn't a fan of any of the other tacos.  I soooo had wished my experience would've been better so I could justify going back here for more tacos. Make sure to ask for everything on them, cause the extra additions and sauces make the tacos taste so much better.

uJCaOfpO-PjuKU9Gqhk0pw.text: One of the best taco experiences I have had in Las Vegas. I had four tacos in total (was very hungry): cabeza, lengua, asada, and adobado. None were disappointing, but the cabeza stood out as possibly the best incarnation that I have had.  I dug the way they have the restaurant set up, since you can see the meat being cooked where you're ordering from. It adds a little extra time if you are ordering from multiple stalls but is well worth it.  The prices are ok, I wouldn't say the selling point is the price though--it is the quality of what you get. The tacos are perhaps slightly on the small end but not egregiously so.

GWWUaFSG-BViBnMGMfUc4g.text: Relatively cheap (for vegas, but not for mexican fast food) and quick. Salty, greasy meat and kind of small tacos. Each meat has a different line you wait in to order, and you pay at the end at a cashier cafeteria style. $2.40 for each taco. We came on a Friday evening and there was no wait. Seems like it can get extremely busy though.  Outdoor and indoor seating. This establishment is located at the end of the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 al pastor tacos, $2.40 each

pdv01GxxZ0Mhj3LD3GAnLA.text: Do NOT(!) be intimidated by the lines you see inside, even if you're surprised at their length when you go at an off peak time(i.e. early to mid evening). They move quicker than you may think, and before you know it, your food will be ready and served to you. Honestly I went by here a bunch of times before finally realizing I should pull a trigger and do a visit(and ultimately on my last trip I went here twice, and wish I'd done more visits), and I'm honestly not sure when you don't see lengthy lines inside.  Anyway, the process is simple for ordering. You order in whatever line that has the meat you're interesting in getting for your tacos, and I got the impression you could order things from different designated lines as well if you want to. I know at least on one of my visits, I ordered an item that wasn't on the menu board for the specific line I chose to order from. After that, you turn around the other direction(behind where you were facing in the line towards the kitchen area) to the register, and pay.  Food was really great here, and I never was disappointed with ANYTHING I ordered. The adobada(spiced pork) was my favorite of the tacos I tried, but I also liked their al pastor taco as well. And also, the horchata and whipped drink machine was nice to see inside, and I liked trying all those various drinks out while I was here. I wish at least one Chicago taqueria, had a drink machine like this! If there at least one Chicago taqueria out there that has such a drink machine that I'm not aware of, please respond to this review and leave me a comment. Not talking about any places with special mom and pop sodas in the machine btw, like the one at Tacos In A Bag in Chicago.  But yes as I said when starting this review, this place is a MUST TRY if you're in Vegas. Don't be put off if you see a long line even at a time when you don't think the line will be as long(i.e. late afternoon/early evening, or if you go at midafternoon on some day), just brave it out and enjoy your food. I always thought the staff here really does try, to move along the line and serve everyone at a good speed.

jSwKAppJStaMIHGs0YCJKQ.text: It's Taco Tuesday!!   We stayed at Encore so this place was super close by. There's also Walgreens and other stores down the street if you need to get anything else after. I highly recommend the Adobada, which is basically spicy pork!! It's honestly the only meat that I get lol. The fries were also pretty good too! We were able to share with a few others. I'm not sure what the green sauce they use is but it really adds to the flavor. Plus the food comes out fast, yay!!   Overall, I always make a stop here whenever I'm in Vegas hehe. (: This is place is worth the hype, forsure. It's a great place to eat after the day club or if you want to grab a late night meal! We ate here several times when we stayed. Note it can get pretty crowded at night and on the weekend though.

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States

neEcD1ujze_OinrtG1zUcw.text: Ok.. about a 40 minute wait on a Sunday morning at 1am.  They had a man singing in the patio area in Spanish to entertain the crowd I'm sure.   By the time we paid and found somewhere to sit it was about 2am so an hour total between waiting and finally getting to devour our food.   Once you get inside there are 2 separate lines.  1 for carne asada, the other for al pastor. If you Came with someone else you'll have to wait in different lines.  You can order fries in any line.  My recommendation would be the adobada al pastor tacos. These were well worth the wait and don't forget some extra avocado dip.   One you get your food, you have to walk to the cashier located by the fountain drinks are the rear of the place by the exit doors to the patio. Kind of an odd setup cause it's backwards but I guess it works.   Freshly made tortillas and freshly grilled carne asada.  You can watch the lady rolling the masa into a ball with her hands and pressing it with the tortilla press then grilling it on the grill.   Ordered 10 carne asada tacos, 6 al pastor adobada tacos , small carne asada fries & a drink. Total was 55.26. Took some home for the family.  Indoor and outdoor seating.

gCiMKlFCm0FviNVQmYqQGw.text: This used to be a taco go-to spot.  Alas, as many restaurants and establishments go, this too also waned in its original culinary glory.  We went today at the Charleston location and the experience was flat.  As in Gru punctured my birthday balloon flat.  The taste had lost its hype.   There were very noticeable portion control measures that had taken place since our last visit.  Long gone are the green onion sides.  Replaced by regular onions.  You only get one pepper now.  Also, the round slices of grilled pineapple are not cut in slivers.  Sigh.  I guess we'll need to find a new taco spot...

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s not what it used to be

UYHVuhAmodPWrhzZtz4wfQ.text: LO MEJOR DE LA MEJOR ADOBADA! AWESOME SPICY PORK!! ONE OF THE BEST CHEAP EATS ALONG THE STRIP!  Originally San Diego based, this Las Vegas location (now there are two) has flourished from the very moment they opened nearly a decade ago.   Their signature meat is the adobada - spicy pork marinated with a mixture composed of vinegar, a variety of peppers, and herbs and other spices. It is then cooked by a gas flame while folded over a vertical rotisserie.  Often also known by the name al pastor. These are some of the tastiest marinated pork tacos I have ever tried, which includes some of the most iconic spots to get them throughout southern California where I am from.  The meat is incredibly flavorful, tender and juicy. Succulent is a word not often associated with meat prepared in this fashion because it is sliced thinly and quickly dries. Their made-from-scratch, creamy guacamole also adds another dimension to the flavor and texture. The sweetness of the pineapple, which rests on the top of the meat as it cooks, softens the meat and further adds to its flavor essence.   Choice of meat fillings include the following: Adobada (Spiced Pork), Carne Asada (Grilled Beef), Azteca (Grilled Beef and Catcus), Tripa (Beef Guts), Buche (Pork Stomach Lining), Suadera (Beef Breast), Cabeza (Beef Head), Chorizo (Mexican Sausage), Lengua (Beef Tongue).  The other choices are good to great as well. All tacos are wrapped with their house-made corn tortillas. Tripas and chorizo were also fantastic but the adobada is in a league of its own.   Tacos de adobada or tacos al pastor - whatever you want to call them - this place is a must stop if you are a fan. They are as good as it gets.  Conveniently located in the middle of the Vegas Strip, next to the Wynn and Encore hotels, and open late (until 2am).

Not only is the food overpriced but it doesn't taste fresh or originally homemade as they claim. Everything was bland :/  The wait is ridiculous. There is a line for each type of meat. Seriously?! Who has time for that?! Management needs to come up with a better system.   Regardless, this place is nothing but hype! I was not impressed at all.   If you want real street tacos that have an addicting taste, then you need to try Tacos El Venado in North Hollywood.   Tacos El Gordo, I will not be returning. Thanks a lot of nothing. I should've just gone to sleep..

lUBi7dIpG67xlZerUjO-aQ.text: The inefficiency in ordering does little to take away from, the combination of fresh and unique tacos. Incredibly tender, the tender meat offers no resistance upon chewing.  Skip the fries, they are wannabe McDonald's, leaving you wanting to be at McDonald's.  They can and should do better here round out a meal.  As for the ordering process, there are separate lines for tacos.  You grab a tray and head to the one you want to get.  You may wait on several lines before you are able to sit down and savor your hunt which is not clear if arriving the first time.    Don't make the same mistake I made and bring a non pork/beef eating friend here.  They won't find much if anything to eat other than some bad fries.

FLBCkPC7ErCxSoQOY7-ltg.text: In Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas, Duke's attorney asks if the tacos he is getting are "authentic Mexican."  "We have tacos. I don't know how Mexican they are." is the response he gets.  Well, at Tacos El Gordo in La Vegas, the tacos are in fact both authentic, and Mexican.  I had the less adventurous carne asada tacos, which were probably on the order of three stars compared to others I have had, but she went ahead and tried the real thing - the beef tripe, beef head and beef tongue tacos, which she said were very good.  The tacos come pre-made, with onions, cilantro, spicy salsa and guacamole, nothing more to add, on hand made corn tortillas.  At the food order spots you may ask for free grilled peppers and green onions. Self service for limes and sliced radishes.  Tacos are $2.60 each, and on the small side, but not tiny.  Take Out (they wrap the paper plate in foil) and dine in.  Within walking distance to the Encore (take out for the suite).  This is their newly opened location that was closed for a bit for remodelling, has outdoor seating.

ZIrIAVfIZtD9yG-8rEf6Dg.text: I had really high hopes for this place since it's so popular even among bayarea visitors. And all I can say is that it was mediocre at best.   The bf and I ordered steak, lengua, pork, and al pastor tacos. The sauces were good but nothing special. The tortillas were just barely warmed up on the grill. We like our tortillas crispy! And my bf said their al pastor meat reminded him of Chinese char siu LOL, which was kinda True. Normally the al pastor meats are more saucy and juicy, and this one was on the dry side.   I've heard from friends that the SD location is way better the LV. I think I'll stick to the local places in the Bay Area.

aJOStFkbzIR6f6kuD6fe9A.text: For everyone who doesn't have the luxury of living near the San Diego/Mexico border, you can now get your Tacos El Gordo fix in beautiful Las Vegas.  For the uninitiated, it is absolutely worth visiting if you are a fan of authentic Mexican food.  Just beware of the ridiculous lines during lunch and the silly ordering system that works in theory but fails miserably in execution.  When you get there, you'll see that there are multiple lines for each of the meat stations.  Each station is supposed to be dedicated only to a particular type of meat or meats, but the lines aren't labeled and it's more of a free-for-all to get to the front than anything else.  To further cause problems, people will wait in one line (carnitas for example), but when they get to the front they order something that's supposed to be from another station (asada for example).  This causes delays because the guy at the carnitas station will have to ask the guy at the asada station to make something for the guy who stood in the wrong line in the first place, which causes both lines to get further backed up.  Confused yet?  Yeah, it's a big mess.  But let me save you the trouble of having to wait in multiples lines.  I've tried pretty much all the meats, and I can confidently say the only meat that really makes this place unique/special is the adobada (spicy pork aka al pastor).  It's frickin' delicious!  The meat has a perfect balance of crispiness and juiciness, and is packed with salty sweet flavor.  Whether you get it in a taco, tostada, quesadilla or whatever, I guarantee it will be good.  The other meat choices don't even hold a candle, but you can wait for them if you want.  You've been warned!

sslSleNGauynhY01yO1S9Q.text: Ignore the low reviews; they don't know what they're talking about. Anyone who could compare this to Taco Bell is either loco or was born without taste buds. This is literally better than anything I ate at Wicked Spoon or Bacchanal, and for a fraction of the cost (and, tbh, ambiance).  Now I'm not that knowledgeable about Mexican food, and it's not one of my top 5 favorite cuisines. That said, this is the one of the few places I ever actively want to go for Mexican. In fact, I hardly eat tacos anywhere else anymore, just to save up my taco stomach for whenever we come to Vegas. (My other favorites we go to far less frequently, as they're in Santa Barbara and New Paltz, NY.) I also appreciate that this is one of the few more authentic places that offer flour tortillas to gringas like me.  My favorite tacos here are the lengua (tongue), cabeza (face/cheek), buche (pork), and al pastor with raw onions and no cilantro. I can't rank them in finer detail than that -- my favorite is whichever one is currently in my mouth (phrasing)! They each come with a different sauce they put on for you, and all of them are distinct and delicious.  I also like the queso asada with salsa and guacamole, though the asada is a bit too salty for my tastes (the salsa and guac balances out the salt a bit). I usually don't get this.  The vampiro is not for me because it's made with corn tortillas, but lucky for me the queso asada has all the same fillings. Normally I like brain (give me a Midwestern brain sandwich or Indian lamb brain curry any day) but the sesos taste kinda off to me here.  Fries (campechana fries $13; lengua fries - full order $15, half order $7.50) aren't anything special, but are huge and great for sharing.  I haven't tried the quesadillas ($4.50 with any meat except lengua or $4.75 with lengua), sopes ($4.50 with any meat except lengua or $4.75 with lengua), tostadas ($2.25 with any meat except lengua or $2.40 with lengua), or mulas ($4.50 with any meat except lengua or $4.75 with lengua).  My husband likes that you can get pretty much whole raw radishes at the condiment bar.  Drinks are the self-serve fountain variety, mostly Coke brand. I'm not a huge fan of horchata but it's of note that they have lots of flavors you don't see everywhere.  Others have explained the multi-line system so I won't go into detail, only to echo that when it's busy (in other words all the time), having to get in line multiple times to order different food and then pay for it causes your food to end up lukewarm by the time you get to eat it. My trick is to order only 2 tacos at a time, from only 1 window at a time, get into the pay line, sit and eat, and then get back up and go to the next window you wanted and repeat the process. Then simply lather, rinse, and repeat until full (5-6 trips for the two of us, but we're total pigs - YMMV). Keep in mind though that the traditional-sized tortillas used here are on the small side - no Taco Bell size tortillas here that fill you up with the carby part, and they don't put 2-3 tortillas per taco like they do at taco trucks.  Ordering them a few at a time gets you way too many napkins. We try to be considerate and stack up the clean ones and put them back so we don't waste too many.  The only downsides are the crazy multi-line ordering system, and they don't have tortas or corn smut.

WIFISzVajZgC6O-UkkzVxg.text: Best Mexican Tacos in all of California! Would recommend the Mula de  adobada!! If you come to Vegas you have to try this place

photos.caption: Photo of Tacos El Gordo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mula and tacos de Adobada

iwcjPt58GSKnckJ3r4zvqw.text: Tacos El Gordo blew me away with their attentive staff, impossibly clean bathroom (lots of graffiti, but clean), low prices ($2 tacos), and expectation surpassing food. I had three tacos.   Steak taco was the least good. Topped with guac and salsa, interestingly the steak was somehow very smokey tasting despite them grilling it before my eyes. Had the flavor you'd get if you threw a steak into a barbeque with wood chips. The flavor was good, but seemed out of place in a taco.  Spicy pork suffers from False advertising. Not at all spicy. The pork inhabits a vertical spinning spit usually seen at your favorite Gyro spot. It's basically a take on Chinese Char Siu (Roast Pork). They've even colored it red and have a pineapple at the top of the spit which they give a squeeze to every once in a while to keep the sweet glaze going. Quite interesting, although not as juicy as I'd like since they seem to have kept mostly lean pieces.  A shame.  The chorizo is their masterpiece. you order it and they cut a link loose and burst the insides out of the casing onto the grill followed by some sauce. I'm at a loss for words, but not appetite.   If you want your mind blown, the only word you need to know when entering Tacos El Gordo is Chorizo.
